One of the most underated films of recent memory.
I cried, jumped, yelled and sat at the edge of my seat for most of the movie.
Excellent acting by every cast, a definit classic.

Author: 27 December 2011
Review_Url: Tommy Riordan (Hardy) trains to be a Kick Boxer and ends up fighting his estranged brother, Brendan, (Edgerton) in the big fight. Both brothers want nothing to do with their father (Nolte).

Author: 5 January 2019
Review_Url: The biggest pile of predictable BS. I waiting and waited for a twist but there was no payoff at all. And talk about being unrealistic. The only thing more unbelievable in movies history was Kevin James winning and MMA fight. Don't waste your time.

Author: 26 September 2020
Review_Url:
Shouldn't it have been a fight between strangers, not a fight between brothers? After all, the writer couldn't write a story well unless he had something in common with the people they were fighting? It's a shame that it's turned into a family drama because the subject matter is interesting. I think family dramas are easy to set up. That's because it's easy to explain the motivation of the main character. What do they fight for? For my family. Like. As soon as the story gets a little bit stuck, they turn it into a family drama. Well, from a business point of view, if it's a family drama, there might not be many mistakes, but as a movie fan, I'm tired of watching family dramas.
The director also made a movie called The Accountant. I like that movie better than this one. However, that movie also had a pretty big theme of brothers in the last part of the movie. I wonder if this director can only write about brothers? Normally, I'd think they'd try to avoid story overlap. If you haven't made a bunch of movies yet the story is similar, I have to suspect that your talent is already exhausted.
It's wrong that the storyline is that an amateur who isn't in the world rankings but an amateur can get an opportunity to battle against in a major tournament.

Author: 26 December 2020
Review_Url: So I just watched Warrior and this is one of my favorite movies of all time. I'm not exactly sure where it would go on my favorite movies list but I think it could be in the top 10. This movie has some problems yet still manages to be so good when movies with less problems aren't as good and the reason why I think that is because of this movies highpoints those being the boxing matches which might be the most exciting things I've ever watched in a movie despite most of them being predictable they are still so exciting and so brutal and are made even better by the fact that you want certain characters to win. The acting is great and I really like the characters especially Brendan Conlon who was by far my favorite character.

Author: 20 January 2012
Review: Move over Karate Kid, Warrior is in town...
Review_Url: This movie has it all!! It was brilliantly directed and has all the components of a great movie. There is a beginning, a middle and and end. The story line is great!! There are these two main characters who are brothers. One of the brothers is Marine and really mad at the world. The big brother is a school teacher who is about to lose his home. They can both fight. Tommy is the younger brother and hits people so hard that he knocks them out with one punch! The older brother - Teacher, is good to but he is not that mean an angry. They both have Nick Nolte as a father - can you say Oscar? Nick was awesome as the father that for some reason they both hate. That is never really explained. I think it's because their Mom died of cancer and Nick was too busy drinking booze to care. Anyway, there is this one great scene where Nick can't take it anymore so he drinks booze and listens to Moby Dick with his walkman. He is crying and screaming the words to Moby Dick (the novel, not Led Zeppelin song). So, the fights are great. Teacher is at one point fired from his school for being a fighter by the principle - Mr. Z. One thing leads to another and in a match called Sparta - the two brother do so well that they eventually have to FIGHT Each other!!!! This final fight was better than Bloodsport, Enter the Dragon and Karate Kid all combined!! The two brothers also hate each other for some reason. Actually Teacher doesn't hate Tommy as much as Tommy hates Teacher. I can't figure that out either. All you need to do is watch this movie and be entertained with the great fighting scenes! I give Warrior TWO UFC's UP!!!

Author: 4 May 2012
Review: Superb Movie - as good as Rocky!
Review_Url: This movie so very excellent, it deserved more Oscar nominations. It easily finds its way among the best fighting movies of all times and in my opinion it's as good as, if not better than, Rocky. The last sequence specially is amazingly well done and brings you close to tears. The fights are portrayed stupendously, and in fact they seem extremely real.

Author: 15 April 2018
Review: A deep emotional treat, belonging to genre - family drama and sports.
Review_Url: Generally people will assume 'Warrior' to be a sports movie before watching it. I would like to enlighten you that this movie is much more. It contains a family where a Father is trying to be again part of lives of his sons. Another father trying to fight through his daily battles, who has to save his daughter from some medical complication. It also shows the relationship issue, among the brothers rising because they have grown apart.

Author: 12 July 2022
Review_Url: I have watched this movie about a dozen times. It still moves me to watch how two brothers from a terrible upbringing manage to grow up and how their lives were shaped from the different paths taken.

Author: 19 January 2022
Review_Url: This movie does not deserve the 8 rating it currently has. It is basically just one big cliché.

Author: 4 April 2012
Review_Url: The movie industry has collected its fair share of boxing films, but not quite as many MMA, mixed martial arts, films. Especially not one with the kind of star power that is behind Warrior. The film follows two brothers who have been distant all their lives and it tells the story of how an MMA tournament brought them back together. It's got a mixture of hard hitting brutality and a soft spot of emotional prowess. It's a story of family set on the stage of organized fighting, only this stage is octagon shaped.

Author: 29 November 2015
Review: The best film I've ever seen
Review_Url: Now I'm a huge MMA fan (mostly ufc) and this film has everything for me from drama to fighting and I absolutely love it, it gets put together so well and it has made the best film in the world.finally an MMA film that gets the credit it deserves well I think I needs more though and don't get me wrong there have been some good MMA movies from never back down 1 and 2 and then even here come the boom.I also love how they have tried sneaking in a few professional fighters like Anthony Rumble Johnson and Nate marquart and then they even put in Kurt angle which I never even realised it was him the first time bug he fits so yeah.Tom hardy and Joel Edgerton are excellent at playing brothers alongside and against each other and they are perfect for this. I have seen it so many times I've lost count and every time it comes to the ending I'm happy sad and just really excited. This film does it for me. A must watch for all movie fans. No seriously just go watch it.

Author: 28 May 2013
Review_Url: British actress Vivien Leigh won an Oscar for playing the most southern of Belles in "Gone With The Wind". It is rare that an actor can take on a roll where they have to learn an accent and make it sound convincing to the audience as well as their peers.The two lead roles in "Warrior "went to an Englishman and an Aussie. They are two of the most astonishing performances I have ever seen.Tom Hardy,and Joel Edgerton, you have left me speechless! Where did you guys come from? How is it possible that you are both virtually unknown? I never for one moment detected a breakdown in your accents. You were both truly remarkable. You don't have to be a MMA fan or even a fight fan to enjoy this movie. It is loaded with action, drama, intensity and gut wrenching emotions. A super supporting cast of Nick Nolte, Jennifer Morrison,and Kevin Dunn just added the icing on the cake.

Author: 8 October 2014
Review_Url: What is about this movie to be rated a 8.2 are you blind

Author: 20 May 2015
Review: so it's the fighter, no its rocky, no its bloodsport...
Review_Url: I have to say I actually do like this film but it is more of a guilty pleasure than a good movie. As I am a fan of MMA, Tom Hardy, and Kurt Angle (Olympic gold medalist turned pro wrestle), I was hard pressed not to like it. With that said I can still be objective enough to know that this is not a very good movie. Crummy dialogue, cheesy writing, and way too many subplots render this movie kind of a mess.

Author: 3 April 2020
Review_Url: The movie was done well but the amount of cliches in this movie made me start to hate it. It's so formulaic and when the high school kids start cheering for their teacher I feel myself raging inside more and more.

Author: 11 December 2011
Review: It has it all, from the brilliant script, direction and acting
Review_Url: Check out the official site of the movie, maybe read a few reviews, note the all around critical acclaim and top rating for this movie; all of it is deserving. I was hoping for a good performance from Nick Nolte because I'm a steadfast fan, but I was not sure if Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton could make a good match with Nolte. They outdid themselves; they performed with the skills of veterans, not overreaching and maintaining their respective character's persona. Nolte was obviously perfect for the part; Hardy is far more versatile than I knew (I've seen several films in which he was supporting actor) and Edgerton did hold his own, not weakening the top tier cast (I'm not yet a fan, so am slightly reserved in my praise). The supporting cast, talented and hot looking Jennifer Morrison in particular, did as fine a job with her role as Amy Adam did in 'Fighter', and the rest helped make this movie as good as it is.

Author: 22 February 2020
Review_Url: Leaves just enough to understand the family tragedy yet enough to see the end and draw happy conclusions. I rank with movie with the rocky franchise as a feel good fight film with story and great into to mma

Author: 6 June 2012
Review: What occurs when Rocky Redux doubles down
Review_Url: Don't get me wrong: this is a well-produced and well-acted story that has all the fighting elements you'd want in a film that includes brutal, knock-down MMA.

Author: 17 December 2011
Review_Url: If you like a movie filled with clichés you will love this one. Me and my friends watched this and it's easy to predict what's gonna happen. Oh, and don't forget, one of the actors plays an ex marine! Cool? Nope..

Author: 31 March 2017
Review_Url: Movie is great , no matter what genre you like most , watch this movie you will not regret it 100%. So emotional and inspiring in many ways , especially if you have brother watch it with him , and you will start to respect your relationship more and more with him - p.s. f/*k but I cry every time ..

Author: 19 May 2021
Review_Url: I gave this movie my customary 20 minute sniff test, and while it's well done, it was just too cliche, predictable, and boring.

Author: 18 February 2013
Review: A great sports movie - what did you think you were watching?
Review_Url: To the low raters citing so called American clichés or holes in the plot as reasons to justify a weak rating...folks, it's a movie about Ultimate Fighting? What were you expecting - Shakespeare? That's like saying the English Patient was a terrible effort b/c it left you sad on the way out of the theatre! I'm not even a UFC fan and I still found this to be a great ride.

Author: 3 December 2022
Review: It is not bad but top 250?
Review_Url: This was enjoyable.

Author: 20 January 2012
Review_Url: I was blown away by the quality of this movie with overall great performances by everyone involved. They kept the real MMA fighters to limited roles with no dialogue where they didn't have to do much more then bring legitimacy of having real MMA fighters involved with the movie without bringing the movie down in the process of having to sit through their attempts at acting.

Author: 14 September 2011
Review: Surprised to discover one of my Favorite movies this year!
Review_Url: I really had no intention of seeing this movie based on the trailer, but since we seem to be in a dry spell right now with no new big or must-see movies out there and because I saw that other people were giving this movie such high marks, I decided I should give it a shot.

Author: 2 February 2013
Review_Url: A story written with heart not brains. A story brought to life with some wonderful direction and an even better performances. The movie is so well written and directed that at one point in time you feel you are not watching the movie but actually living it. Only a few movies are ever able to accomplish this.

Author: 16 March 2021
Review_Url: I really enjoy this movie, it is not only for fight fans. It is really good and has very good performances also.

Author: 4 February 2012
Review_Url: A former alcoholic boxer (Nick Nolte) faces his past in the eyes of his two sons, Tommy (Tom Hardy) and Brendan (Joel Edgerton). Things tend to get personal during a mixed martial arts tournament where both brothers participate.

Author: 25 October 2012
Review: I created this account specifically to review this film...
Review_Url: ****spooooooooooooooooooooooilers!!!!!!!!!!!!*********

Author: 11 February 2022
Review_Url: Loved it. And my eyes got sore from all the tears... family is always something that will create who you really are.

Author: 7 March 2022
Review_Url: Just here to drop the overall rating. It is ridicilous 8.2. No way this deserves more than 5.

Author: 20 January 2012
Review: Definitely worth to see not as good as been rated
Review_Url: OK fight scenes are supreme. Man I want to watch some real MMA.

Author: 18 October 2015
Review: Family conflicts are not easy to overcome.
Review_Url: Loved this movie. Tom Hardy is off the charts with this one. Worth the time for sure. I was equally impressed with the character of the the father, Nick Nolte. His own struggles with alcohol, the war, the family troubles and the distance created by all of it. The military aspect didn't quite tell a tale there and was far from accurate in legalities but the ideal affect was achieved, the government always reclaims what is theirs according to them. The script writing was a bit sluggish, like pulling teeth at times. I don't care for missed opportunities to say what should be said in any situation. When I write, nothing is left hanging unless it has to be. I believe in writing of true human emotion and not Hollywood style where you have conversation with huge emotional impact but never say all that should be said. Mostly, the human race is not like that. We feel it, we say it. This movie tends to leave too much hanging in the air. Thick pains of oppressed emotions. Still love the movie though.

Author: 7 June 2023
Review_Url: I do not like fighting movies - in fact I despise them almost as much as movies where animals are mistreated but yet I watch them because every so often we are blessed with absolute and complete poignant brilliance like Million Dollar Baby. Every step of this film exudes talent. Nick Nolte, Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton are separately strong but together they reach a height that is rarely seen - they ARE the Conlons...... they live and exude and breathe this family and all their tragedy and challenges.....

Author: 12 July 2014
Review_Url: Having just watched this film I feel it is necessary for me to do a review of this straight away.

Author: 8 January 2012
Review_Url: Personally, I have always maintained that "Rocky" 1&2 are Sylvester Stallone's best movies; not because these movies paved the future for Stallone, but due to its huge underdog factor. Everyone loves a good underdog story and this is also why "Rocky" has always ranked within the top 10 on my list of favorite movies. Having said that, I now see a serious contender to one of my favorite movies of all time.

Author: 24 December 2016
Review: Great movie with great performance from Joel & Tom
Review_Url: Loved the plot of the movie. The performances from Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy are really great. They both show the love real brothers will share in real life. One fighting for saving of his family (daughter and the house) and the other one to give the money to his best (dead) friend's wife. Tom Hardy really looked like a MMA fighter in this movie. He was bulky and strong and looked as if he can really kick some serious stuff. Joel on the other hand looks perfectly like a professor with a family. The ending scene kind of made me cry where Joel just lifted up Tom and started walking out of the ring without caring for the officials or anyone else.

Author: 1 September 2021
Review_Url: This movie is fantastic, great story, great characters and casting.

Author: 22 February 2019
Review_Url: Another transformational role for Hardy, who takes on a physical challenge of being a fighter with an animalistic toughness, that covers the sensitivity of a small boy.

Author: 26 October 2012
Review: Unfinished Storyline - made up for with amazing acting and intense moments.
Review_Url: I absolutely loved this film, but at the same time it was nowhere near perfect. To start with I'll talk about the things that really annoyed me about this film, and then I will talk about how it managed to redeem itself.

Author: 7 November 2016
Review_Url: Sometimes I feel I need to write a review to right a wrong. This is one of those times. I believe that this is one of the greatest films of all time The writing, the acting, the directing, the photography, the score, and the editing were all of the highest caliber. It is wrong that this film did not win several Oscars. Apart from the injustice done to all who made it, the lack of Oscar recognition is a tragic missed opportunity to encourage thoughtful, deep, deeply artistic, and deeply moving film-making. When I think of all the millions spent on truly stupid films and then think of Warrior, my heart hurts. I would like to say something directly to those who collaborated on this masterpiece: I thank you with all my heart for this beautiful and moving work of art. I hope that you will not be discouraged by the lack of proper recognition for what you did, and that you will make more films of this quality.

Author: 20 July 2012
Review: Great cast! Slow beginning! Good action! Perfect ending!
Review_Url: For some reason - and I do still not know why exactly - this movie was not released in cinemas here in Germany but is only available on DVD and Blu-ray which is in my opinion a huge pity. It is a great, a really great movie that, as far as I can tell nearly has everything a great and dramatic movie needs. And yes it is a great and dramatic movie, Maybe not actually a drama but certainly it is not what the German publishers must've thought it is: Just another martial arts fighting movie! It's not at all. Of course they fight in the movie and admittedly it is very well done so they must've put some thought into it but in general it is about the relationship of the two brothers and also their father.

Author: 25 December 2011
Review_Url: The initial reviews floored me of this being a great movie.

Author: 1 December 2011
Review_Url: Firstly I need to clarify that I do understand the gravity of the statement I've just made and yes Im ready to stick my neck out and say this is the best fight movie ever made! The perennial problem with fight movies is that it has always only appealed to the sex blessed with testosterone and only a handful of movies have managed to transcend the barrier. Rocky, Wrestler, Fighter and Fight Club being the ones I can recall from the top of my head.

Author: 18 January 2012
Review: Warrior (2011) - Fight for Family! Fight for Country!
Review_Url: "Warrior" is another of those classic boxing movies with powerful characters and strong fight scenes. This mixed-martial arts drama is a combination between "Rocky" and "The Fighter". This is half underdog story, half boxing movie, and half brotherhood tale. "Warrior" is set with an ex-Marine named Tommy, portrayed by Tom Hardy (starring in the upcoming "Dark Knight Rises"), who teams up with his recovering alcoholic father, portrayed by Nick Nolte, to help him train for the biggest event in the history of the MMA. On the other half of the story, we meet Tommy's brother Brendan, portrayed by Joel Edgerton. He's a married man, a public high school teacher, and a former MMA fighter. But when he loses his money, and is about to lose his house, Brendan also enters the MMA competition to save his family. Then, when these two brothers team up for the same tournament, they have to finally confront each other, and the forces that tore them apart, in the biggest battle of their lives. All I have to say is this: "this is awesome!". This is a spectacular, amazing, exhilarating, powerful, and unforgettable movie, and this is one of the best movies of 2011. I was completely blown away by this movie. I was kept on the edge of my seat, wanting for more. Director Gavin O' Connor knows how to make an underdog boxing story. This movie has a bunch of well-written material, fine directing, and tons of powerful fight scenes. But it's the casting ensemble that really carries the movie. Tom Hardy does an amazing job playing such a powerful character, and I can't wait to see this guy in the final Batman movie. Joel Edgerton delivers the finest and underrated performance in this movie, and I really like this guy. But, it's Nick Nolte that deserves a Best Supporting Actor nomination for his work as Tommy and Brendan's ex-alcoholic and emotionally damaged father. I really thought that Nick Nolte steals the entire movie, because he makes the movie good, with all of his heartbreaking and dramatic moments, and he still has lot of charm in his heart. The cast is truly the best thing in the whole movie. The fight scenes are top-notch, the cast is well-acted, and the finale leaves you with jaw-dropping surprises, and edge-of-your-seat thrills. "Warrior" is one of the most entertaining boxing movies ever made, and it's truly one of the best of 2011. "Warrior", in my review, "a dramatically powerful brotherhood story".

Author: 12 January 2020
Review_Url: Recycled Rocky. Complete with video split screen video training montages. Nick Nolte absolutely horrible in the most cliched role ever as the alcoholic trainer. This movie is as bad as it gets. Loud. Obnoxious. Pretentious.

Author: 13 May 2012
Review_Url: I honestly do not understand how this movie could pass me by almost unnoticed, until I followed a recommendation from a friend.

Author: 13 February 2022
Review_Url: Any movie that makes me shout and cry is a solid 10 period! Great fight movie with heart... watch it and enjoy every minute.

Author: 8 January 2012
Review: A Movie For Anybody with a Beating Heart
Review_Url: If you only like to watch movies that have a dazzling twist at the end or where you really do not know what will happen next, then Warrior might not be for you. Warrior is Cliché in movie terms, but cliché in real life terms too which is not cliché but is. Make sense? Warrior is a movie where you know the direction it's heading in, but at the same time, it's a movie with some very real, disturbing and painful issues going on. The MMA fighting is what's going on on the surface, but beneath the surface, that's where the movie really lies, and that's what makes Warrior a truly great film and above most(if not all)films in this genre.

Author: 1 September 2021
Review: The greatest MMA movie ever made
Review_Url: Comes from the most simple of concepts! But includes the emotions that come with trying to be the best and a parallel storyline of the two brothers. Loved the use of jiu jitsu and acting and this movie wasn't far off a 10/10 but lost the point on making Dan a bit too strong to the point where you think Brandon would have no chance.

Author: 6 April 2022
Review: I cry but want to fight someone
Review_Url: It's safe & typical for a family sports film, but it works so well. Wildly intense with very strong emotional content. The dialogue is raw & real while the fights are rough yet inspiring. The story shows the power of family and forgiveness.

Author: 28 June 2022
Review_Url: What a ridiculously unbelivable, incoherent, brainless, totally improbable, very thin familiar drama mixed with an apparently attempt of comedy that incommensurably failed.

Author: 8 May 2012
Review_Url: This is a very emotionally driven movie, with pitch-perfect performances.

Author: 8 February 2013
Review: Grabs your attention from the first scene
Review_Url: This movie is one of those top dramas that will be remembered for a long time.

Author: 13 May 2022
Review: I don't like to watch people fight in the ring but I loved this movie
Review_Url: Very emotional suspenseful film about Facing the past, forgiveness, love - a moving cathartic experience, Told through the grit and determination of two brothers who were not willing to give up or give in. The fight scenes were brutal but filmed very well it was truly hard to know who to root for. Although the ending was satisfying-- at the same time I wanted to see how things resolved after the fact between all the family members!! It would've been nice to see them all having a backyard barbecue at Brandon's house at some point in the future-- at least I'd like to imagine that as the ending. Pops celebrating another sober mile stone (After losing his sobriety at the event) and his kids giving him and each other another chance. You get the idea it's possible -that happily ever after can come when you're willing to pay the full price with no half measures.

Author: 28 December 2012
Review_Url: Warrior tells the story of two brothers in their quest to succeed using MMA as their gateway to success. Tommy Riordan played by Tom Hardy plays an ex war veteran feeling the demoralizing affects from the war who feels that his life has lost a sense of meaning as if it has run its course. Tommy enters the MMA tournament in efforts to relinquish any self-doubt and shed a new light into his life back home from the war. Tommy's brother Brendan played by Joel Edgerton, enters the tournament in hopes of winning to save his family from their financial crisis they are in. The two brothers never had a good relationship being that Brendan(Edgerton) abandoned his brother and abusive father when he was 16. Tommy (Hardy) never truly forgave him as they both parted their separate ways in life. The two of them end up fighting for the championship.

Author: 8 October 2015
Review_Url: Very intense, interesting and does the trick for building suspense, but, in my opinion, lacks the interaction between main characters. The conversations Tommy has with his dad are not very passionate and the viewer just can not know what to feel.

Author: 8 April 2018
Review_Url: Wow, all those good ratings for this bloated and silly movie. Yes, Nolte was great, but Hardy WAY over did his brooding mysterious angst. Just too many times during this one that you say to yourself AS IF. Guys fighting in back-to-back MMA fights? Brothers of no true skill or fight fame wind up in the biggest world wide event ever? One of them gets pummelled with hundreds of punches in the face but never a drop of blood and he always manages to win? Please. Comparisons to Rocky are laughable, that movie had heart and was very believable.

Author: 19 February 2020
Review: Ruined by the biggest cliche ever!!
Review_Url:
Started brilliantly. Epic acting...humour, emotion, turmoil, addiction. Tom Hardy as fabulous and as talented as ever. Nick Nolte knocking it out the park.
And then the whole 2 hours ruined by a predictable, idealistic and completely irritating ending!
You have a hard as nails, psychotic, new on the block beast of a fighter, ex marine (Tom Hardy) knocking out MMA world champions with one punch in the first 5 seconds, but put him up against his skinny brother - he crumbles, ends up with a broken arm and looses the lot!!! Fuming. Utter nonsense. Don't bother. If you want a fairy tale, watch Snow White and the Severn Dwarfs.

Author: 1 September 2019
Review_Url:
How does it take this point! Interesting.
Mediocre,known fight movie by everyone.

Author: 24 September 2011
Review_Url: When I had first seen the preview for Gavin O'Connor's 'Warrior' I wanted to say that this is going to be a post - any idea we have ever had of any fighter from 'Rocky' to last years 'The Fighter' starring Mark Wahlberg and Christian Bale. Now, after seeing it I'm not so sure if that statement holds the same amount of weight.

Author: 10 April 2015
Review: A beast in man tamed by financial motivation and family values
Review_Url: Over the course of history we saw a great lot of the fight movies. There was Bloodsport and Rocky, Million Dollar Baby and The Fighter. In all these movies there were the heroes, each of them having their own reasons to keep going, to keep fighting. Fighting for their friends, for their pride, for the sake of proving themselves, for their dreams. Or at least for some vain glory. Those heroes were facing the improbable odds, the unbeatable foes - and the only thing that made them victorious was their motivation, their goal.

Author: 21 February 2018
Review_Url: Honestly, beware. This movie had some intense scenes! I've cried multiple times, which I rarely ever do while watching movies, but Warrior has proved itself otherwise.

Author: 16 February 2012
Review: A Masterpiece of acting, writing, directing, and storytelling
Review_Url: I am speechless! I have not seen a film so moving since Secretariat. (What a disgrace to the academy that neither of these films was even nominated for best picture two years running, even though they now have 10 nominees to get it right!) Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte shine brilliantly. Hardy is so intense and filled with seething rage and hatred, while at the same time we can detect a yearning to love and be loved if someone dares to break through all the walls he has erected around his life. What a multi-layered performance! Nick Nolte will rip every father and son's heart clean out (and most everyone else's too) with his wonderful performance as Paddy. But the real star here is the story itself. Flawless camera work, film editing, script writing, and casting have all come together to tell this magnificent story of family, heartbreak, desperation, forgiveness, hope, and triumph of the genuine human spirit.

Author: 24 April 2016
Review: Very good story that will have you tied in with emotion and excitement.
Review_Url: Warrior: A Knock Out or Knocked Out?

Author: 22 February 2019
Review: Best fight movie I've seen for a while
Review_Url: Great movie in the tradition of previous fight epics, great performances all round, but exceptional ones from Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte. Tom Hardy felt menacing throughout, Nick Nolte portrayed the repentent father brilliantly, best I've seen from him for a long time.... superb acting from both!

Author: 2 July 2012
Review: How to use and avoid clichés at the same time
Review_Url: In a grim PIttsburgh town I feel like starting by saying Tommy used to work on the docks but he didn't, he's an ex-marine come home to try and get his life in order and maybe, try and patch things up with his abusive and recovering alcoholic estranged father, cut to Brandon, his brother who by contrast has a great life, seemingly, and a wonderful family. BUT, both of them have problems and the solution for both is to enter the same Mixed Martial Arts tournament for a five million dollar winner-takes-all prize where you kind of know exactly what's going to happen.

Author: 26 January 2012
Review: A Superior film worthy of the title "Warrior"
Review_Url: Gavin O'Connor and Anthony Tambakis have written a superlative screenplay for "Warrior", a film most deserving of all of its great praise. Nick Nolte gives an expected great performance as Paddy Conlon, the father with a sordid past and compelling abandonment issues. Joel Edgerton and the British performer, Tom Hardy, are perfectly cast as the brothers (warriors) and Note's sons. The casting is perfection itself. The fight scenes are brutal yet so compelling that one finds oneself sitting at the edge of one's seat with the excitement of a real match.

Author: 26 December 2011
Review: Best Action movie of 2011, and something to be seen again and again
Review_Url: Warrior is Gavin O' Connor's best movie to date, and certainly one of the best action movies of all times. Beyond the top-notch, and quite realistic action sequences, the movie--as the t-shirt of Brendan Conlon's trainer Frank shows--has the 'soul of a lion'. The backdrop of an MMA championship remains so, in the backdrop, with the key element of drama remaining the tension and struggles of a broken family, consisting of a ex-alcoholic war-veteran father, an elder son who teaches school Physics, and the younger son who suffers from PTSD from the war in Iraq.

Author: 23 December 2013
Review_Url: The film starts off great, a young man (Tom Hardy) returning home to see his dad after 14 years and we want to know where he's been and why he left so we are instantly hooked; turns out his dad was a drunk and Tom Hardy wants nothing to do with him as does Joel Edgerton.

Author: 26 August 2022
Review: One of the most overrated movies I have seen here
Review_Url: Russian world champion gets hyped up the entire movie just to be beat by a scuffed highschool teacher who trained for a few months? And what's up with the drama with him having to win the tournament to not lose his house? He clearly seems to be incredible at this sport so there is no reason why he should ever been broke.

Author: 17 December 2011
Review: The Guilty Pleasure of Watching Brains Being Beaten Out
Review_Url: This movie runs slightly more than 2 and a half hours, but it never bores.

Author: 25 July 2018
Review: people used to have higher standards
Review_Url:
I know these 'Rocky 'movies use poetic license, but come on!
this was called a middleweight tournament, which means their weights should be similar, and Koba was 50 to 70 pounds heavier than most of them.

Author: 1 January 2013
Review: Don't they check sound quality before releasing?
Review_Url: Slow, plodding, could not connect with any of the characters. If anyone can explain why someone accidentally threw a blanket over the microphone, it might help explain the muffled conversations throughout half of the movie. For dramatic effect it was a definite fail. Withoout giving anything away, I really miss the Rocky movies after seeing this 'must miss'. One of the things that really irritates is when filmmakers thrust the microphone right in the thick of special effects and seemingly completely remove it during vital conversations. It implies that the audience suffers from a complete lack of imagination on their own and deem it necessary to supply it for them through loud special effects. I don't recommend this movie to anyone who wishes to be entertained for 2+ hours.

Author: 16 July 2019
Review_Url: This movie is good. But I still can't find out who is the real warrior, Brendan or Tommy? This movie have some amazing points most of fighting movies doesn't have. There are a good family drama, a simple leading character, a mysterious leading character and a disgusting supporting character. It looks like those characters have great back plan stories but I don't know why movie is not explaining properly. Also it is not amazing cinematographically, especially in fight sequences. Camera shakes too much. On the other hand, its main idea is just awesome. In the end of the movie, I just smiled. It was a enjoyable experience.

Author: 24 February 2021
Review: Wow..what is up with these high ratings
Review_Url: This was a very slow ...horrible movie! I usually don't write reviews but after reading the reviews of how great this movie was ...I had to make sure I was watching the same movie!! Did all the directors best friends post reviews!!! "Better than Rocky". C'mon....this is ridiculous

Author: 22 April 2014
Review: neither a motivational movie nor a entertaining(Time waste)
Review_Url: SPOILER: How can you show a underdog went on to win MMA. It is like Japan beating Spain to win world cup soccer.Even luck favors trained people. Just because he is motivated can win MMA is impossible.Even the background story is not properly covered and confusing.Better watch a million dollar baby. I can't believe that it got a rating of 8.3.It is real time waste of 2.5 hrs. A better fighting movie is undisputed redemption 3. the fight in it looks real and fighters look real. This is neither a motivational movie nor a entertaining movie.

Author: 7 December 2011
Review: Nothing awesome as being projected here
Review_Url: Common man...... how this is rated as one of the best I really don't understand. Yes... movies are not rated by looking at the climax. But the director completely lost it in the end. The match was clearly a fixed one. Tommy lost it for the sake of his father and brother. It is clearly visible dude. And what was his father doing in a taxi in the end (out of the stadium) and he was back in the end....there is no meaning you dumb A**. It looks like director was throwing away like giving the audience some thing 'UNEXPECTED'. I am watching the MMA since years. Most dumbest thing was the makeup. Who is the idiot (makeup artist). Did he ever saw any of the boxing or sports movies...!!! Look at the ROCKY movies dude and learn some thing from them. makeup was so unreal. Any one who will be the head of MMA will never award the 5M to the winner of that match. But in the end it was nothing but Bull S#!t. I was actually ready to rate this movie 9/10 before watching it. But after watching I thought 6 is more than enough. I don't understand why makers of the movies think that always making something different would satisfy the viewer. Anyway's Tom hardy was awesome and brilliant with his high energy performance. This movie was almost a letdown.

Author: 9 August 2012
Review_Url: When I first saw this in theaters I was trying to hold back my tears, mainly because I went to see this with guy friends and didn't want to look like a wimp. I couldn't believe how touched I was by this film and that it was creating this reaction from me. Upon second viewing, I reevaluated the film and must say that it is a good movie but not as great or moving as the first time I saw it.

Author: 15 February 2022
Review_Url: Great movie- Tom Hardy was incredible as was all acting. Only thought for me is wrong brother won it... could have been changed to close with the talents and abilities as well as the background of what they both had to overcome... just thought for me would have been inspired more with a different winner- still GREAT ending.

Author: 18 November 2020
Review_Url: Warrior has a pretty simple stories with some cliches that might bother people, but it is so well done with such heart that I just didn't care. Similar to A Knight's Tale, the movie far exceeds the simplicity or sometimes outright silliness of it's premise. It is further elevated by some symbolism and a few interpretations of events that other reviewers have already noted. Everybody in the movie was good, but Edgerton, Hardy, and Nolte were really top notch. The movie wraps you up in the characters struggles so tight that you just hang on for the ride and let the emotions wash over you.

Author: 10 November 2018
Review_Url: Hats off to director Gavin o Connor ,such a stellar script , screenplay ,direction by him . Trio of Nick nolte , tom hardy , Joel Edgerton steal the show, tom hardy was like a raging storm untameable , such a brilliant actor he is . Must watch it to feel emotional side of action..

Author: 27 April 2020
Review_Url: Ive always been a hardcore mma fan, it wasn't until I watched this movie I become a hardcore movie goer.

Author: 2 February 2014
Review_Url: This movie is one of my all time favourites. It has a brilliant story line which really gets you into the movie. The fights are fantastic and the ending couldn't of been done better. I take my hat of to the writers and producers of this film, everything from the actors to the music is spot on. If you like UFC and have any spare time at all watch this film. I have watched films like circle of pain and never back down and this movie beats them hands down. It made me smile, laugh and even almost made me cry at the end. The two brother in this film are perfect, they played their part very well and the dad was FANTASTIC. He was the perfect actor for this role because of his previous role's which made the film that much better. I gave it a 10 star rating and will be for a long time one of the best films i have ever seen.

Author: 24 June 2014
Review: A War Movie where each Warrior Won .........
Review_Url: Directly to the point I was sure Warrior is going to be a typical war movie with usual audience rating it high. It was mostly unknown to me. Now I started watching it and yeah the usual stuff of typical dialogues and family problems. That was a bit boring but I thought it may get somewhere at least as good as the movie Drive.

Author: 10 May 2020
Review_Url: I didn't need to step into the Octagon to feel a tightness on my throat. We are, most of us, damaged in our own ways. This isn't a fight movie, this is a story of a broken family and the trail of damage in its wake; both from the perspective of the protagonists and the supporting casts. Everything comes together at the end, you'll see.

Author: 4 November 2011
Review_Url: This movie...is just exceptional. I'm not a fighting fan, I was convinced to see it by my boyfriend. But I do not regret it! The characters are perfectly cast and beautifully acted. The story is incredibly written, it tells the story of the boys perfectly. I don't know about anyone else, but I started out disliking the father because of how he was inferred to treat the boys and in the end was sobbing with sympathy for him.

Author: 29 July 2019
Review: This movie will make you cry and jump out of your seat
Review_Url: Just watched this movie with my family (all adults) and we were all crying at different parts but just a little later freaking out because we couldn't handle what was happening. Favorite movie of all time!

Author: 5 February 2012
Review: The Best fight film ever?...and much, much more...
Review_Url: First of all Thank You Academy for nominating Nick Nolte and getting this overlooked masterpiece a bit more notice so it MIGHT be given a chance by people who would normally run screaming fro a mixed martial arts movie...or any movie as badly titled as this one is...

Author: 22 December 2011
Review: It is these kinds of films that make us like the Hollywood so much.
Review_Url: Warrior is an action-drama centered around Tommy (Hardy) and Brendan Conlon (Edgerton) who get into a multi martial art fighting tournament called Sparta. The film is directed by Gavin O'Connor and stars Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton along with Academy Award nominee Nick Nolte, Frank Grillo and Jennifer Morrison.

Author: 29 November 2011
Review_Url: Warrior is a befitting descendant to the Rocky series and more recently The Fighter.

Author: 13 June 2012
Review: Warrior: a daft movie with a kick in the tale
Review_Url: Over the past two decades, mixed martial arts (MMA) has become increasingly popular in America. The Brazilian Vale Tudo (anything goes) style was brought to the US in 1993 with the establishment of the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). At first the tournament was designed to find the most effective martial art, but as the UFC developed competitors began to incorporate different styles in order to get the edge on their opponents. As a result, MMA, as it is known today, was born.

Author: 23 April 2012
Review: Warrior is one of the best movies ever made!
Review_Url: I heard something about this movie upon its brief showing at the theater, but because of atrocious advertising it was not seen by many including myself. So upon it's release on DVD and based on all the great reviews by critics and past viewers I decided to rent. Well, as the credits rolled at the end of my viewing I felt I had just watched one of the greatest movies ever made. I don't think "Rocky" or "The Fighter" are on the same level as "Warrior."

Author: 14 March 2021
Review: im sorry tommy, i love you tommy !
Review_Url: This movie is very good. Great director who captures the fight scenes well, brilliant filming, good acting especially Tom Hardy. The only negative point of the film is the cliché of Russian badman that exists in most American films, and in this film we also had a Russian badman... The characterization of the film is also very good and we are somewhat familiar with the past of the three main characters of the film . But the important thing is that this film is about forgiveness and love and not just a martial arts film. That is why it is so beautiful. We see this even in the end ...

Author: 26 August 2022
Review: Emotional and raw. Great fight scenes.
Review_Url: Finally a movie that only shows you only what you need to see for a back story, and allows you to draw your own conclusion without being treated like an idiot consumer.

Author: 23 September 2011
Review_Url: I saw the trailer for this and immediately thought that this was a Rocky for 2011. To a certain extent this is true as everything builds up to the main event - a $5 million cage fight for the toughest fighters around the globe - and it is the story of 2 underdogs both of whom happen to be estranged brothers. Brought up in and then split by a harsh, patriarchal family, the 2 brothers follow their own separate paths - one a physics teacher and family man, the other a troubled marine.

Author: 9 January 2012
Review: more than just a movie for guys
Review_Url: Anytime a movie comes out that involves some form of boxing there's always a comparison to Rocky, and Warrior is no different. The only things the two films have in common are that they were very well cast and each movie is exceptionally well done; the similarities end there.

Author: 4 April 2019
Review_Url: Only just seen this gem of a movie. Never heard of it until I saw a clip on Youtube. Amazing, sheer brilliance and such great acting with such an amazing back story. Will make even the hardest man or woman shed a tear at some stage.

Author: 9 September 2011
Review_Url: Well, i will start off by saying that I'm a Marine, so the second I found out that one of the fighters was a Marine, i had to go watch the movie, not expecting a lot I must admit, since all these Boxing and Fighting movies now a days aren't that great. Well i did get a lot more than what I went for, definitely worth a trip to the theater.

Author: 24 August 2018
Review: Good film, but too many fight scenes
Review_Url: Warrior is defnitealy a very good movie. Its a simple, familiar story thats very predictable. Howeve, this doesnt matter because the film is very engrossing and at the end moving also. The actors all many to portray their characters in a complex way as not to give away too much at once. Nick Nolte as the father is the most convincing, particularly at the end when he is finally forced to notice his forgotten son. The characters are developed perfectly. Their background stories are more functional and predictable than interesting. In general, the film is pretty good. However, the characters do get lost in the second half because far too much time is spent in the ring rather than actually focusing on the characters. Its a good film and I would reccommend that people watch this film ahead of other similar films, such as The Fighter. 7/10

Author: 27 May 2019
Review_Url: One of the best movies I have ever seen. Very surprised how little I have heard about it

Author: 26 February 2022
Review_Url: You don't get much better than this for a movie about fighting.. love both leads and a hell of a fight. The best fight movie since Rocky... Tom and Joe and great actors.

Author: 18 November 2016
Review_Url: Casting was amazing, Overall great movie. Tom Hardy delivers an excellent acting performance. I had never heard of Tom Hardy before this movie, and I can definitely say that after this, I am a fan... Honestly, this movie is on par with Never Back Down. Never Back Down is one of my favorite fighting movies ever, and this one is definitely up there right along with it. I had never heard of a few of these other actors either, but after this, I would definitely say that I am a fan of all of them. Definitely hoping for a sequel and more movies from this cast. If you haven't seen this yet, GO WATCH IT ASAP. 10/10 Definitely would recommend.

Author: 9 April 2012
Review_Url: There's something familiar about Gavin O'Connor's latest film, Warrior. I can't quite put my finger on it. I mean, its a gritty underdog tale about second chances and punching people in a ring for pride, love, cash and redemption. It's also set in and around Philadelphia and features a growling old trainer, sweaty brutes, a training montage and a bunch of rousing scenes that'll send chills down your spine and tears down your cheek. If you're yet to fathom what I'm getting at, Warrior resembles that old 1970's classic Rocky. A truly unforgettable film that very few people still have on their "to see" list yet the unfortunate catalyst to countless amounts of barrel-chested fighting films that were just not worthy of John Avilsen's Oscar winning rock. Bloodsport, Kickboxer, Split Decisions, Fighting, Never Back Down, Best of the Best, the list goes on and on and on. All jokes aside, Warrior should fall into that category with consummate ease. It should be a superficial, clichéd piece of trash. It should be a terrible film. But it isn't. Not by a long shot.

Author: 10 May 2018
Review_Url: Thought it was a good film. The story was good, and the acting was great - Tom Hardy's great in everything.

Author: 24 September 2021
Review_Url: This is hilarious .. i went into tears all over the movie .. this is a must see.

Author: 5 October 2015
Review_Url: Really??what kind of scenario is this.... are we at the 90s when the good and weak must always win??? or must always the ruined family to be loved again...??? It is impossible for an amateur and an old fighter to win this competition. I was expecting a much realistic scenario in which the characters should be responsible for they decisions. It is another thing to give us a happy ending and another to give us a fairy tale. Too bad....rocky was much a better movie and also they stole the Cinderella man inspiration...they don't even make us to feel the emotions they wanted us to feel.. Bad movie...too bad for hardy cause he is the next big thing!!!!

Author: 3 December 2020
Review_Url: Loved the movie!! I watched it multiple times, and the ending always got me teary eyed. Tom Hardy delivered an incredible performance. He never dissapoints , he can play any character!

Author: 26 May 2020
Review_Url: It is a really good movie but the camera angles during fights were so bas. Half-body shots, crowd closeups, punches, half-body shots again...you cannot really feel the fight that way. Maybe its becausw the main plot of the movie is not about MMS but the family drama around two brothers around it

Author: 26 September 2013
Review_Url: This is a truly superb film in every way and so UNDERRATED which was a real shame. Everything in this movie; story, directing, score and acting made this film a classic and must watch film for everyone. It touches your soul with the realistic battles in life and the importance of purpose and belonging. A perfect story to use with teaching students studying relationships and belonging. It was a pleasure to see the outstanding attention to detail in telling this beautiful story. It is unfortunate and confusing as to why there were not more nominations for the acting in this movie. Thank you to all cast and crew for telling this beautiful story and taking us on this journey with you.

Author: 10 November 2015
Review_Url: This movie was a great piece. The story was well written and you truly feel sucked in the whole film.

Author: 24 December 2011
Review: One of the best sport movies of all time.
Review_Url: If i could give this a 8.5 i would When i first saw the preview for this movie, i was a little skeptical. I thought it was going to be like The Fighter, with just less talented actors. To a point i was right, none of the performances in this are as good as Christian Bales, but that being said, everyone did a great job in this movie. Nick Nolte gave a marvelous performance that should be worthy of a Best supporting actor nom. The previews let you know the gist of the story, two brothers enter a MMA tournament where they eventually face off. Even though they are brothers they are very different in character and the way they were raised, the only thing in common being their dislike for their father. The movie shows their current and past life struggles to get them to where they are in the movie and it all leads up to awesome finale. This movie does for MMA what Vision Quest did for wrestling, i just hope this gets a better following.

Author: 1 January 2023
Review_Url: This movie is not just any other ordinary family drama movie. That is because at first, we don't go in too deep on the whole backstory, which I think works extremely well. That's why at first, I was rooting for Tom. We start out with him, he gets more screen time in the beginning, etc. The whole crowd, as well as us, the viewers has its preference on Tom. I was thinking, why this much hate to dad and Brandon. The longer I watched the more my preference switched to Brandon. Which almost feels like a fight in your head, like the fight between the brothers. I am not really the biggest boxing fan, but with this movie it felt quite realistic. It hink this movie doesn't get the love it deserves. So please, give it a go!

Author: 18 December 2011
Review: Gut wrenching action and emotions that will make your cry... The perfect movie
Review_Url: When the movie started, i realized it is not just another movie i went to see in theatre, it's much more than that. But the movie truly surpassed my expectations. I was shell shocked during the movie with action, emotion and bone breaking shots. While we guys consider movies like Never back down, the fighter, fighting with utter respect, but believe me guys Warrior stands tall against these movies. you know MMA stuff man that kills it.

Author: 10 December 2011
Review_Url: This is the first and last time that i'm writing in IMDb.

Author: 14 October 2022
Review: This film is worth seeing, but it's not great
Review_Url: I used to really love this film, but I've seen it countless times and I fast forward a lot of scenes now.

Author: 14 September 2011
Review_Url: After seeing this movie, I had a hard time explaining why I like it so much. I don't like predictable movies, especially sports ones. I don't like movies that are full of cliché. Warrior is a sports movie that revels in the cliché. But I LOVED it.

Author: 9 September 2011
Review: A Great Show well worth the price of admission
Review_Url: If I could make one admonition to anyone reading this it would be to go to this movie with an open mind about the sport. You don't have to be a fan of MMA to like this movie, heck, you just don't have to hate everything related to it to be able to enjoy this masterpiece. The interpersonal relationships displayed in this film are presented impeccably and with such precision that you cannot help but care about the results of every action through out. If you can watch this movie without building an emotional tie to at least one of the characters, then maybe your life has been to easy and you need to take a walk to the other side of the tracks and let this movie open your eyes to the complexity and development of unconditional love. Warrior leaves the question to the audience as to who the title is attributed and it is definitely something worth thinking about. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and recommend it with my highest regard to anyone looking for more than cliché fight scenes and high school drama.

Author: 22 December 2018
Review: A no one beating professional fighters??
Review_Url: The movie was so dramatic, one can't use the same technique against all fighters.

Author: 17 February 2012
Review: On the hall of fame of sports movie
Review_Url: The warrior feels like a different sports film from the beginning. It's the movie that "The Fighter"(2010) tried to be and fell short of being: a truly great sports movie with real family drama behind it.

Author: 21 December 2011
Review: One of the best films of 2011
Review_Url: Tom Hardy who is British & Joel Edgerton who is Australian play American brothers & their accents are flawless. Overall the acting in this movie is textbook perfect. If Nick Nolte doesn't get an Oscar nomination - there is no justice. While both lead actors are in their mid 30's & thus seem a little old for the punishing fight scenes - they do pull it off. I understand that both of them suffered injuries during filming. No matter they are both great in their performances. I've seen them separately in other films & they remain two actors worth keeping an eye on. I don't see them doing too many romantic comedies however. But maybe they will pleasantly surprise us in the future.

Author: 25 May 2018
Review: A family feud settled in the octagon
Review_Url: While not free of several sports film cliches, Warrior succeeds as a serious drama about two brothers who must reconcile a dark past. The plot is simple but directed with focus, anchored by three strong performances from Joel Edgerton, Tom Hardy, and Nick Nolte. The fight sequences are decently executed, functioning more to escalate the tension than provide spectacle.

Author: 10 May 2021
Review: Brilliant Acting. A Silly Predictable Soap Opera Screenplay.
Review_Url: Unfortunately, this could've been a great movie if the story wasn't so ridiculously predictable. It's a very disappointing Rocky cartoon retread. Great performances by Nolte, Hardy and Edgerton completely wasted.

Author: 24 September 2020
Review_Url: Great acting, but I'm not recommending it for any MMA fan.

Author: 28 July 2022
Review: Worst fight movie I've seen, it felt like a disney movie....two hours that I'll never have back
Review_Url: Way too unrealistic characters and the most predictable plot ever, there is no way a former wrestler would be able to beat pros with just a few weeks and months of training...at least make it so it has some sense. Nick Nolte was amazing for such a garbage movie. The ending was simply awful.

Author: 30 March 2020
Review_Url: I love a good underdog story. This was so horribly told I'd rather die than watch it again. The wrong brother won, and let's be real. The one that fought the Russian? Should be D E A D. Poor execution, absolutely unrealistic even for fiction. Hated it. Only the miserable and idiotic would call this quality.

Author: 18 August 2022
Review: Such a good movie, with a bad ending
Review_Url: The only reason this isn't 10/10 is because of the unnecessary and unrealistic ending that was thrown in for cheap emotions and a shot at an Oscar. The whole film was perfect, down to the last minute detail, but then BOOM in your face it removes two stars from my rating.

Author: 29 March 2020
Review_Url: Comparisons to Rocky are incorrect. The character development isn't there. You don't care enough about Tommy and Brendan. Plus, their story doesn't make sense.

Author: 15 April 2012
Review: this is Rocky for the next generation
Review_Url: If I want to keep it quick and easy just read my summary title. I recall this movie coming out at the cinema and I avoided because it was a 12A which means lots of screaming chatting teens turning up who spoil the show. Finally saw this on blu ray and in a word wow. The story works well and newsflash here, both the stars can really act (Tom Hardy of course is Bane in the new Batman movie). The mma and choreography in general is crisp and sharp and you can't help but cheer as you watch. I really don't get why such a well made movie didn't do better at the box especially when you look at some of the rubbish that does well. Two brothers who went on very different journeys in life with an alcoholic father and nothing in common to unite them. I even love the contrasting styles. You have the former marine who blasts in short and sweet and finishes the job. His brother a school teacher on suspension for prizefighting mma (ironically). He is a thinker but former mma star in his own right and is a lot more technical and calculating for a better word. Anybody watching this who studies martial arts or mma will have a smile whilst they watch this. Karare Kid this isn't.

Author: 12 December 2011
Review: The best sports drama film to date
Review_Url: In every sports drama film, there is the underdog overcoming the arrogant champion, the washed up aging athletes seeking redemption and coaches who come up with a pep talk to boost the morale of the team every half time. In Warrior, it doesn't follow the traditions. The mixed martial arts tournament serves only as a backdrop to a broken family composed of two brothers and their father. You have the elder brother, Brendan who enters the tournament to save his home from foreclosure while the younger brother Tommy enters to make a promise to his fallen comrade by giving the prize money to the widowed. The father however, longs to redeem himself by reconciling with his children who also are...estranged. What's so unique about Warrior is that there is no clear protagonist and antagonist, it is about their own issues that they're up against, particularly Tommy who has this deep resentment towards his father and elder brother. It is a story about forgiveness and redemption from the sins of the past, I'm hoping that this film would get Oscar nominations. It's a highly recommended movie for the family and their teenage children as well.

Author: 9 September 2021
Review: Top 5 movies of all time see this movie
Review_Url: The title says it all! 10 out of 10 easily the acting and story are as good as Shawshank or braveheart this is my first review ever on IMDb.

Author: 2 April 2016
Review_Url: Tommy Riordan (Tom Hardy) is a Marine and former MMA fighter who returns to the sport to support the widow of a friend and veteran. His father Paddy Conlon (Nick Nolte), is a recovering alcoholic who reconnected with his Catholic faith, helps train and corner Tommy. Footage of a sparring session where Tommy knocks out prospect Pete "Mad Dog" Grimes (former MMA fighter Erik Apple)leaks and goes viral. Tommy finds out about an MMA tournament called Sparta, where the winner will be awarded a $5 million purse and decides to enter. Tommy's decision to have Paddy train him is partly due to the fact that no one could give the kind of specialized attention his father did.

Author: 11 June 2015
Review: One of the best movies of 2011
Review_Url: If you like Sports Drama Genre, this is the best of best... Tom Hardy was spectacular in this movie. Story was pretty amazing narrated too. If you really liked Million Dollar Baby, this is the next level of heartbreaking and emotionally satisfied s**t.

Author: 6 May 2023
Review: On the top of my list
Review_Url: Ok confession first, this is one of my personal favourites. When i saw this movie on circuit, i honestly had never heard of it. Plus i am definetly not a fan of boxing or martial art movies. I paid to see Nick Nolte and Tom Hardy because id seen everything else. What i got for my money was one of the greatest movies of (my) all time. I dont cry, i dont cry in movies and i dont cry at funerals or weddings. But i had a tear in this movie which was an unusual feeling for me. Just an incredible writing and performances by Nolte and Hardy in prticular that involves fractured and damaged emotional mental health of Hardy who seems to be self destructing. Together with his father who is one bender away from losing it completely. Is all so well played out and so bell made. All time classic.

Author: 12 April 2012
Review_Url: people, people...

Author: 7 April 2022
Review_Url: There is a lot of great boxning/martial arts with a strong story out there, and Warrior is one of them, a modern day Rocky.

Author: 20 March 2012
Review_Url: This movie was recommended by a friend and it took me a while to see it. I watched the trailer and I thought it's another film about fighting.

Author: 20 March 2012
Review_Url: So two brothers Tommy who has recently returned from war and Brendan a former fighter who has a family to support and are the sons of an alcoholic former boxer start fighting to earn money. Brendan wants the money to save his family's livelihood and Tommy is fighting to earn it just to give it all away to a widow of a fallen comrade. They are both portrayed as protagonists however to me it seemed that in the end Brendan came out looking like the selfish ass in the end. The final fight makes me so angry because there were so many opportunities for Brendan to do what he did during the fight before the fight. Tommy's lack of taking credit for his heroic actions and him taking responsibility for something that wasn't his fault makes him the selfless protagonist the one you root for because he is so selfless, honorable, and heroic. Brendan is the person you cheer for because he is the underdog. In my opinion Brendan only won the fight because he was a cheap and manipulative fighter not a better one. The story of hate and forgiveness was sweet.

Author: 14 July 2016
Review: A tricky Hollywood ripoff the Korean Classic Crying Fist
Review_Url: I'm only giving it 5 because of the good actings and some visual work....story-wise, it was a very cheap Hollywood version of the Korean movie "Crying Fist"(2005), which, however is a far better movie story- line and direction wise. The single-cut boxing round shot during the last fight of that Korean movie is easily one of the best fight choreographies ever done. and yet IMDb gives that a much lower rating than this one!! But how come not single person mentioning this here?! All you Hollywood junkies...get out there and watch some real deal before calling THIS the best boxing movie ever..... Tom Hardy was good...nick was awesome....but the movie was very slow at times and kind of predictable since the very beginning...it was a movie about throwing punches that lacks the PUNCH itself....on the other hand, two rookies suddenly starting to beat up world's top ranked MMA fighters is just too much to digest, and kind of an insult to the sport itself! and i'm not even talking about the plot- holes...watch "Crying Fist"instead and you'll see how characters can be built.

Author: 23 October 2022
Review_Url: First 25 minutes very good, but then falls into really bad multi-sequence editing, predictable cheesy-film conventional story and bizarrely poor soundtrack. Not a well made film and not a 8/10. I reckon Hardy was using it as a body build-up for later role in Dark Knight Rises. Scene where one brother announces apology and love while the other one grunts during floor wrestle is utterly daft. Fight processes are unlike real MMA, all very comic book.

Author: 7 January 2012
Review_Url: It turns out that I went to the movies to see MI4 (great movie, by the way), and on my way back home, I stopped by in the movies store to rent a DVD and fill my lonely night. It turns out that I rented a masterpiece. You will see a deep story that on its surface bleeds action. You will cry, laugh and shout from your seat out of spontaneous emotions. With every discussion between the characters, with every non expected punch, you will feel like you are in the movie, like you are part of the story. Believe me if I tell you I didn't want this movie to finish. Believe if I tell you that this one makes "The Fighter" look like an average movie. Believe me that for a moment I forgot who the hell Rocky Balboa was, and all the sudden, the credits were just rolling up.

Author: 3 June 2017
Review: Likely best movie seen this year.
Review_Url: The approach the movie takes in developing every character is truly excellent. All three main characters, Nick Nolte, Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton have outstanding performances. I am a guy who appreciates MMA and this movie gave it justice. Watch this movie and get ready to see an quality flick.

Author: 17 September 2011
Review_Url: I tried to like this movie-- I really did. After all, I am into kickboxing and have tremendously enjoyed the fight/drama genre in the past. But if you are a fighter yourself, you probably won't enjoy this movie much, either. The fight scenes consisted of mostly repetitive moves and those ended way too quickly for the most part. Tom Hardy's acting was extremely unbelievable, in my opinion, and I couldn't connect with his character emotionally; what is up with the teenage boy attitude? His brother's behavior, too, was not very convincing: one minute he is this nice lovable teacher, and the next he is an arrogant SOB who is very picky about whom he chooses to love and forgive. Overall, it was a far-fetched and unoriginal story.

Author: 19 August 2015
Review: This is what a great movie should be like
Review_Url: Warrior is without a doubt one of those movies that contain everything a good movie should: an original and interesting story; great acting; suitable music; and a perfect mix of entertainment and emotion.

Author: 8 February 2012
Review_Url: This movie is what Hollywood is about. Pure, emotional, bestial , true and... simple. A real introspection in what winning is and is not. But... They chose the wrong winner (And it's what we like or not). The bestial brother needed to win over his fellow 'smart' family member. Just a little lack of daring on a story basis from a Hollywoodian perspective. But it's really all we can reproach to this piece of art. I cannot not think of the The Wrestler and the not yet disfigured Mickey Rourke (of 9 1/2 weeks) when I see the lost soul in this movie who grew up with the mother and left the army shamefully. Just a bit too American maybe... just maybe... The realization is sensational. At the end of the movie we really feel like getting out of reality. This movie was the best that UFC could expect. In 'Warrior' We are deep in the Greek empire as noticed by the father of our two heroes somewhere in the begging. This movie is an epic journey. Who know, maybe in two thousand years mythology will be about watching such movies... I can hardly grasp how awesome it will be to study history in 2000 years.

Author: 18 February 2022
Review_Url: Definitely one of the worst martial arts movies of all time. What an American slime...

Author: 8 December 2021
Review: MMA Rocky but without all the leather and tight a$$ shorts.
Review_Url: Wow! This movie is as hard as they come. Last 45 minutes was intense as hell.

Author: 16 January 2012
Review_Url: A good movie ruined by such a dumb ending that it's actually offensive to the intellect.

Author: 9 December 2011
Review_Url: I have just watched Warrior for the second time and it hit me just as hard as the first. Hardy, Nolte and Edgerton along with the rest of the cast, deliver such an emotional and powerful story in Warrior. The film may not please those who want all-out MMA action but what it does deliver is a real-life story that we can relate to and believe. This film hits hard, both physically and emotionally, as we are reminded of what really matters in life; the love we have for those close to us. I, personally, think that the acting from the characters is real and you can feel it.

Author: 10 December 2011
Review_Url: This is the best movie about MMA fighting. It is definitely not better than "The Fighter" or "Rocky". I wish it was the best but it wasn't. I'm sorry. Where did it fail? The weak script is partly to blame. Go back to "Rocky" and see what made it a classic. There's not enough establishing wide shot to make it a classic. If you watch spielberg's movie than you know what i'm talking about. The first half was good. But the second half started to play like a music video right up to the brothers duel. Not enough clever and powerful dialogues to fill the last 30 minutes. Even the fight announcements from the ring masters would help. Its just too silent for me towards the end. So that emotional ride for me got lost. A little bit more wide shot of the actual fight would be contribute would make it more real. See "rocky" and "the fighter" All in all a very good job! Make the sequel a classic please !! yay

Author: 28 December 2021
Review_Url: Warrior is a well made and directed movie, with lighting that consistently fits with the mood and cinematography that is skillful and intelligently used. The dialogue was thought-provoking and written with vigour and heart, the fight scenes are incredible feeling both authentic(you can smell the sweat and feel the tears) and harrowing and the story for me was absorbing and hit me hard emotionally.

Author: 4 February 2012
Review_Url: This is the first movie I have ever given a rating this high, the reason being the researchers obviously did their job very well as one of the characters is obviously suffering from PTSD. This is an illness I suffer from myself and could so relate to why he was like he is, It was shocking how realistic it made that character seem to me, and I have never experienced that emotion from any film I have ever watched. Putting all that aside this is a proper heartfelt sport/action/drama movie anyway and is well worth a watch, and will leave you feeling glad you gave up the time to do so. I started watching this movie with low expectations, as i wrongly assumed it would be another story-less waste of an hour and a half or more of my life, but was shocked and surprised how good it is. Watch it you will not regret it.

Author: 16 July 2012
Review_Url: You could over think this to much, but simply, this film is STUNNING!!!!. Tom Hardy in probably the best film he's ever made in the best character he's ever portrayed. It emoted the right emotions, at the right times and you really believe in the cause. Tom Hardy IS the Warrior.

Author: 23 April 2018
Review_Url: A drama made for men as they say, and yeah, pretty much. Two brothers form a broken home got into a fighting contest, while dealing with their issues.

Author: 20 July 2012
Review: Action for the boys + emotion for the girls = Great Date Movie
Review_Url: I loved this movie! Initially I thought my husband would like this movie, I hate to admit that I would normally never watch a movie like this simply based on the subject matter; cage fighting. But I'm glad I listened to the reviews.

Author: 19 April 2023
Review: Great cast in a compendium of cliches.
Review_Url: It would be unfair and inaccurate to say that this movie has a screenplay. What it has is a checklist of cliches loosely slung together in the vague form of a screenplay.

Author: 21 December 2011
Review_Url: Despite the good reviews here I wanted to put off watching this movie for a while as I thought this will be one of those standard movies where they develop a plot just to take it to the last fight which is supposed to make up for everything else the movie may not be. I finally got to watch it and was pleasantly surprised on how well the whole movie was executed from start to end. The movie had many chances to slip into the ordinary but they carefully kept off that road and made a really convincing movie. The lead characters are neatly developed without overdoing any of their individual traits. The fights also had the right balance to it, thereby gelling with the rest of the movie rather than standing out and causing a distraction. 'Balance' is the right word to describe this movie as all the elements are carefully balanced to deliver a good movie. Definitely worth a watch.

Author: 9 March 2012
Review_Url: WARRIOR

Author: 16 October 2018
Review_Url: I won't compare this movie to any other sports-drama movie. It is neither Rocky nor The Wrestler. To do this movie justice, one must appreciate its beauty in all aspects. The acting is excellent; especially on Nick Nolte's part. The story progression was not cheesy. Everything was delivered in a subtle and seamless way. As the story goes on, you get to connect the dots and understand where every character is coming from. The direction is simply awesome. The ending might be considered cliche by some, but I find it different.

Author: 3 December 2011
Review_Url: I don't usually write movie reviews, but I felt compelled to after seeing this sensational film. I can't believe that it didn't get a wider release in Canada, or somehow slipped by me. I am not a big UFC fan, or fight fan for that matter, and nor is my wife (who balled her eyes out in several emotional climaxes of the film); so don't believe that it's a film only for fight fans. It is in fact more of a family drama with UFC as the vehicle and backdrop in which to tell that story.

Author: 3 November 2018
Review: Despite no interest in MMA - my personal favourite
Review_Url: This movie will tear you apart and put you back brick by brick. It's incredibly intense, raw, and above all beautiful. The relationship between the main characters, their own personal fights that they take into the cage... Astounding. Just rewatched it and I still cannot believe what an incredible adventure this movie is each time you see it. Acting, music, camare angles... Incredible.

Author: 30 May 2020
Review: Good fight film, just not a great film.
Review_Url:
For anyone like me who started to watch this and was concerned over the terrible first scene (so much back story shoe-horned into such awkward dialogue) and almost gave up right away - this is for you: I had this film queued up to watch for over a year or two now so I decided to stay with it.
Sure the acting is pretty wooden in places (Nolte nominated? laminated more like); the dialogue and plot are cliched; the fight montage is laughable; and some of the main characters fail to come across as anything but comical, but the film has something that keeps it going and there is some good acting (usually when Hardy gets a chance), and there are some good moments that aren't in the ring, just not many elsewhere.
It's not the great film that many would have you think but it's not terrible either. The fights are where it shines, and my pulse was racing during these, so if you're not a fight-film fan then set your sights a little on the low side if you want to get through the build-up to the final scene (which I'll avoid any comment at all about).

Author: 18 January 2014
Review_Url: The movie presented an obvious plot line and gave a new perspective to getting beaten up. Giving the blueprint for how to win UFC, just get beaten relentlessly for 3 rounds and then perform an camora and break one of your opponents limb's on the bell. Tommy had knocked out several fighters in the first round but remarkably his brother seems to be able to gain super- human abilities and defies the laws of UFC.
