As Brenden didn't punch for 3 rounds and was stuck in a full mount against a first round knockout artist by making a impenetrable guard impervious to the ground and pound. Overall the director should learn some UFC rules and tommy should have knocked out Brenden in the first round. The movie leaves a lot of questions unchecked at the end plus the fact that Brendon had a abandoned MMA for teaching seems to have helped him rather than doing the opposite. There is no logic to the final fight and has a predictable ending as the styles made it obvious that the submission had to win.

Author: 13 January 2012
Review: Whoa!!! Now this one is a killer for performance!
Review_Url: Tom Hardy is the man to look for! An absolute marvelous all out performance and performance only driven film. Such strong character buildup that at one point I was so strongly feeling the eventuality to not let happen. I wasn't looking for the final fight to happen as it would mean either of the two protagonist to go down which I was so biased towards both of them at the same time.

Author: 1 April 2012
Review: You just can't ignore Beethoven in Warrior.
Review_Url: With all due respect to the excellence of film artists amidst the hype of Hollywood stardom (even without having seen the other movies), this one, "WARRIOR," I really wanted to get BEST PICTURE 2012, and I could see no other in its place. And far be it from me to say, but I think the voters kind of dissed Beethoven because he was too wonderful in this picture, but then again, I'm a musician. Nobody could have rightly fit Beethoven into personal tragedy in these times involving the effects of war rising out of decades of U.S. conflict in the Middle East—beginning back with Desert Storm and Kuwait and Iran, and then later Afghanistan and Iraq after 09/11, and God knows what after. Fittingly, the film brought much of this into play. Called "Warrior," the story tells of two, warrior types, brothers in conflict affected by the unexplainable things that face our own human condition, just trying to grow up and raise a family in this world, and then with this utter senselessness of war pounding them further down. Immediately you pick up on the tension happening with the brothers. And Eegad! They're Irish! And thencatharsis takes you in—you begin to feel that purging, evolving steadily, slowly out of the Beethoven streaming "Ode to Joy" gloriously all throughout. And you felt this burliness too, of the fighters—despite the terribly awesome intensity of emotions the brothers were called to portray, their smash-down burliness served only to heighten an indescribable "machismo" in these two actors, whose names I did not register immediately, so much were they into their character—Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton. Nick Nolte, on the other hand, was just coolly brilliant. Right at the beginning, you caught glimpses of his saddened eyes of repentance for his derelict ways, with just a wee smile of hidden pride in the boys. Aw jeez, I felt like I was almost watching "Long Day's Journey into Night" — seriously! The whole cast and crew should still be partying up! Amen?

Author: 18 January 2012
Review: Grab the most comfortable chair and enjoy
Review_Url: I really like MMA, and I did figure this would probably be lame. The fighting was done very well. If Rocky was a movie that you liked , then I am pretty sure you'll like this even more. It has a few stories behind the story that are also very interesting. By the time 20 minutes goes by I knew I was going to like this movie. I originally put the movie in to fall asleep to, but as you might have guessed my interest level was so high there was no way I was going to sleep. After the movie I did sleep but I was probably throwing kicks and punches all night in my sleep. This movie has the right mixture of emotions. Nick Nolte plays a part well suited for him with high's and low's all through the movie. I do like fight movies but never gave one a 10 until this one came along. A must see.

Author: 6 November 2012
Review_Url: Walked in the theater wanting to just see a fighting movie for entertainment and it was the cinema where only a few people went in to so i could get a good seat. And god was this film more than amazing! I couldn't see any weakness in it whatsoever as some fighting movies tend to just exaggerate the fighting scenes coupled with shallow acting. In this movie however, the acting was really really great. From Nick Nolte, Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton and even Jennifer Morrison! Nick Nolte could very well be nominated for an Oscar. That's how great the acting was. And as a guy was I surprised it made me cry. Character development is so amazing too. Everything about this film is amazing, I was wondering at the end why only a few people had watched it. Those other people don't know what they are missing. It is my first review here in IMDb since I made this account and this movie very well deserve to be rated.

Author: 7 February 2022
Review: It's like a fight movie spoof
Review_Url: I'm not a big fan of MMA but I've seen enough to notice the fights look ridiculous more like WWE.

Author: 18 March 2022
Review_Url: A competition of 16 of the world's best fighters ends up with two brothers, one a high school teacher who had some UFC experience, and the other who as far as we know had zero experience. And they beat the world's best fighters? How are they even allowed in the competition?

Author: 22 February 2012
Review_Url: This is the best movie of the year. It has the elements for both gender. Fight scenes for guys, and emotional/love scenes for gals. The fight scenes are very well conducted. Seem very real. It's extremely hard to find male actors who can fight AND act, I mean real act at the same time. Tom Hardy is brilliant. Joel Edgerton looks a lot like Conan O'Brian. It's a little weird for me to watch comedian 'Conan OBrian' do fight scenes. Tom Hardy is so sexy in this movie. I love strong men with something vulnerable and childish inside. The love between brothers and father/son is strong yet subtle. Men don't express their love for each other easily and often. I'm touched to the bottom of my heart when I see them communicate their love through fights and arguments. They can seem strong from the outside, harsh to each other. But the love is stronger. I think Tom Hardy deserves an Oscar.

Author: 16 January 2012
Review_Url: Directing 8/10- Solid directing, intriguing shots and well paced. The fight scenes were phenomenally choreographed. Acting 9.5/10- Some of the acting from the extreme minor roles was cheesy but nick nolte, edgerton and hardy gave amazing heartfelt performances. It's sad to see that nolte, in particular, is not getting more recognition for his performance, his performance was riveting. Screenplay 8/10- The screenplay was rather cliché and predictable. However, I have yet to see another sports film a better and deeper character story line. I have also yet to see a mixed martial arts film this deep and heartfelt. So it's original in those aspects. Visual Effects 7/10- Nothing crazy at all visually, but its not needed with a film like this. The fight scenes were filmed with near perfection. Sound Effects/Music 9/10- The music throughout was solid, but what really lifted the film was the ending song. It tied the scene together in such a beautiful fashion. Overall, great film that might sadly be overlooked. Amazing storyline between the characters and definitely one of the best sports films of all time.

Author: 14 April 2012
Review_Url: One the worst films a saw in while - and that goes especially for the screenplay. The only reasons for holding up until the end were the fight scenes. And even they became so unreal and the end. The plot was definitely not worth the book it was written on. War hero, Russian bad guy, school teacher MMA world champion ??? A broke war veteran, without PST, who will donate his prize money to the widow of his war buddy? The writers had totally NO idea where the story was supposed to be going to. Fragments of anonymous family biographies, desperately linked up to produce a script. This quality is even worse than a beginners failure... sorry

Author: 5 April 2019
Review_Url: Fantastic movie, outstanding performances from Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton.

Author: 13 August 2022
Review: If you don't like this movie you are boring
Review_Url: Greek drama setting: a long lost drunk father, two alienated sons. Both on opposite sides with their own grudge against father. A fight to the tap over honor, wealth and pride. This a simply a good movie with a good cast and a good story. It rocks! If you don't like it you s..k.

Author: 29 November 2011
Review_Url: Personally i give it a 10 out of 10 because i loved everything about this film, including and especially the fighting (girl here). With a cast like this there is hardly anything bad you can say about it. It certainly has heart, certainly has a story, it makes you think, it makes you feel and it makes you relate..and it made me cry. It made me cry because when you look at just how much these men (the family) had been hurting by who did what, when and why which broke the family apart, and then what brings them together even if just about..you just can't help but to think and/or relate to it slightly and cry...or not.

Author: 30 December 2011
Review_Url: Does this film really need any more reviews? hmmm OK 1 more~

Author: 13 August 2020
Review_Url: When you have to constantly lower the volume, and then raise the volume then the whole movie experience is ruined. It makes no sense how loud the background noise gets and how loud the music gets compared to the voices. And then some voices are extra low volume. Please fire whoever was supposed to make this movie a unified experience.

Author: 6 February 2012
Review: The Fighter, Rocky and Million Dollar Baby mixed in one great movie
Review_Url: I was when I consulted the premieres of the week that I came across the despicable poster Warrior. See: two muscular men, naked trunk in a movie called "Warrior" and subtitled Portuguese is "Fighting Between Brothers". Well, let's say Warrior is buried deep with a picture of these for the first printing. It was when I saw some reviews and by high scores to the film that I thought maybe the thing was not so linear as this, because in almost all the film was held in high esteem, with high scores and the surprising rating of 8.3 on IMDb, that puts you in the top 250 films of all time. And it is confirmed: Warrior is a great movie. Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton play two brothers separated for 14 years, created by an alcoholic father, played by Nick Nolte, who taught them to fight from a very young. The first became a lone Marine and a second physics teacher, married and father, which is currently in serious financial trouble. As for the father, this was abandoned by both sons, who ignore and cut off all relations with him, preferring to forget it. That's when Tommy (Tom Hardy) returns to her father's house 14 years after the plot develops, and the biggest tournament in mixed martial arts history will take place. More than a sports movie, Warrior is a great drama with brilliant performances by Nick Nolte (nominated for best supporting actor Oscar) and Tom Hardy, the British actor who had done a good role in Inception and is now preparing to play Bane, the villain of the next Batman movie, The Dark Knight Rises, and that is undoubtedly establish itself as a rising star. All dialogues and scenes in which Nick Nolte appears are fantastic. The character of old father, abandoned and sorry that strives for the children to accept and to love again is superbly embodied by the actor, creating thin links between family relationships and the spectator who leaves no doubt moved. Tommy is also excellent. The actor Tom Hardy builds an unstoppable wrestler, dir would be invincible until, apparently almost no feelings, disgusted and enraged by the children he had. A fighter who is more like a rabid dog that a dark man. Already Brendan, played by Joel Edgerton, while also being well can not be at the other two. Perhaps because of its character is more "normalized" (Brendan is the underdog, a retired fighter competition in whom nobody believes) the player will eventually have less room to maneuver, or their abilities as an actor does not really go to meet their pairs. We tend more to this second option. The two brothers have to rest a single scene of dialogue throughout the film that reinforces the emotional charge and the separation between the two, this scene once again superb. The dialogues and dramatic aspects, but even very well exploited, in principle would be the highlight of the film. It would not be combat scenes also exceptional realism and movement of a camera that impresses us very original, as if we were to actually watch the UFC fights on Sic Radical, forgetting that those who are fighting are actually actors . Note also positive for the dedication of both actors in learning martial arts and especially for Tom Hardy and his rigorous physical training, appearing on the screen with a monstrous muscles, specifically for the film, causing us to remember "method actors" as Adrian Brody in Predators or Christian Bale in Dark Knight and Machinist. Highlight for further engaging soundtrack. Warrior However, despite being a film very dear, is not a bed of roses. There are some inconsistencies that can not be ignored, such as Tommy was fighting unbeatable champion Greco-Roman in his youth, only to have changed his nickname now enters the tournament as an anonymous, unknown if any data on it, which turns out to be ridiculous. The realism of the final scene also ends up leaving something to be desired. And unfortunately Warrior ends up suffering, though not of evil in a maddeningly combat films, this is the successive cuts of exciting fights to see the reaction of secondary characters, sometimes extremely annoying, irrelevant and end up being comical and in bad taste, which is following the fighting at home. Still nothing to compare with the heinous Cinderella Man, perhaps the most disgusting film's dramatic fight I've ever had the misfortune to watch. Warrior actually turns out to be an overview of the best that is done in The Fighter, Rocky and Million Dollar Baby, for all the reasons cited above, and not without a scent, but a little, feeling Hollywood (bloody cuts to Watch the reactions of secondary characters), but this is not necessarily bad, quite the contrary. Causes this is an interesting film, addictive and dare I say inspiring, with a dramatic charge well dosed and ultimately go positively different genres of cinema. Objectively Warrior hangs between good and very good, 3 and 4 stars. However, bearing in mind I have just my personal opinion, and with great satisfaction, to assign the top note and hope that justice is done and Nick Nolte is awarded.

Author: 17 October 2012
Review: Two brothers making a name for themselves
Review_Url: The movie "Warrior" is a tale of two brothers who chose to take separate paths to escape the burden of their alcoholic father. However, both decide to take up fighting to help with their family's finances. Brendan (Joel Edgerton), a teacher, fights in strip club parking lots to make a little extra money to prevent his family from filing for bankruptcy. Tommy (Tom Hardy), Brendan's brother, is a Marine but runs away from that life after his best friend is killed in combat. When Tommy returns back home, he becomes homeless and seeks refuge at his father's house. To fulfill a promise to his fallen comrade's family, he begins fighting for money at the local gym. While the brothers train for their upcoming fights, they see an ad for a UFC tournament in which the winner takes home one million dollars. After seeing this ad, the brothers decide that they will embark on a journey to fight until the end.

Author: 18 November 2011
Review: Best martial arts movie/sports drama ever seen
Review_Url: This is one of the best movies I've seen past few years. Storyline, acting, visual images, fighting scenes, everything is just perfect. Usually, when I see a movie get awesome, over the top critics, mostly it ends up being pretentious crap. But not this one, this is a really entertaining movie and is a must see this year. It is great cinema, but also a quality movie. The only thing I'm really wondering about is, why the heck did they have to put in the Russian guy?? Come on, wasn't that a bit obvious and unnecessary? It just reminded me; yep, still a commercial Hollywood movie. All in all, you should see it, and you will enjoy it; so will I seeing it the second time with my husband; so good is it!

Author: 29 December 2011
Review: A true diamond in a sea of garbage.
Review_Url: Warrior is the most heart-melting movie I've seen in a while. Movies of 2011 have been all the same, and much of a disappointment, if I may say so. But this one is different. The story of two troubled siblings, each fighting for it's own just cause, whilst avoiding the ghosts of the past. Their worlds will rumble as they will have to face each other, their father and their most well-kept secrets in a fight that will decide the life of the one or the redemption of the other. With every fight won, I cried tears of joy, with every punch taken, I feared for the brothers. This movie is so touching, even though it dwells in the primal sport of the MMA. A true masterpiece, probably the best that 2011 has given us so far.

Author: 7 September 2013
Review: Really good but just missed being great
Review_Url: I loved this movie up until about 30 min left, I still really liked it but the ending was just too unrealistic. So Tommy the younger brother comes out of nowhere and beats the best fighters in the world easily without hesitation, I can buy that. There are always great fighters coming out of nowhere. Now the speed he beat people in was unrealistic but that wasn't what bothered me. What bothered me is his brother Brendan, not the character but what happened to the character. So he was out of fighting for awhile and all of the sudden he joins a contest with the best fighters in the world. He was obviously older than all of them and hadn't fought in years. In every fight he gets beat the crap out of but somehow in the last minutes he pulls off an amazing move and gets a tap out. Literally every fight of the tourney he gets beat up badly but wins. Nobody can take the beatings he took and pull out a win, maybe in the first fight but not in 4 fights in 2 days. And when he did fight in the past he wasn't even good, they mentioned he was a .500 fighter. I don't know that just kinda ruined a great movie for me. The movie as a whole was really good though.

Author: 10 January 2012
Review_Url: Brendan and Tommy Conlon are two estranged brothers of an alcoholic father, both whom have cut ties with. The younger brother, Tommy (Tom Hardy) who is AWOL from the Marine Corps, returns home to his father. Tommy, deeply resentful of his father (Nick Nolte) and brother, begrudgingly seeks his father's help to train for an upcoming MMA Tournament. He makes it clear to his father that he wants nothing to do with him, other than to train him just like he did when he was an up-and coming high school wrestling champion. Tommy has a lot of skeletons buried deep in his closet, all of which slowly start to come out as the film progresses.

Author: 30 September 2011
Review: The Good, The Questionable, The Bad and Why... Warrior
Review_Url: The Good - Not much. Yeah right! Where do I begin, this is a movie about a family and how fighting (MMA) affects their lives. Honestly, do not be misled by the title, while fighting is a part of the story this really is a movie about family. From the offset and from the trailers we know two brothers will be doing battle for money in the mixed martial arts arena. It sounds like a cheesy 80s movie but it is far from it. What makes this movie work is the fact that we come to understand how this dysfunctional family comes to fight for money. That's the core of the story, two brothers with history who can only settle it in one way. I won't say which brother wins but it is one hell of a thrill ride to get to that point. But more importantly this is a movie that just works, and I have to tell you it is an Oscar worthy story.

Author: 21 July 2012
Review_Url: Probably one of the most emotional and inspiring films you'll see in a long time. Tom Hardy is a stand out in this film with his portrayal of a man with the bad boy look but when you see the film you know why. It's like all the Rocky movies put into one and it shows us why he is now a Hollywood star. Nick Nolte does amazing in his role as the father in the film and Joel Edgerton also gives a stunning performance in this film of determination and grit. The film starts out a bit slow and if you haven't seen the trailer then you probably aren't sure what it's about but within 30 minutes you pretty much know what the story is about and although in my eyes the ending was a bit shocking, I still feel that it ended well and the characters were given a good ending to the film.

Author: 7 February 2012
Review_Url: Went to see this film on it's opening night last year and I was blown away, Warrior is the best fighting film since Rocky all those years ago, that's the best accolade I can give it.

Author: 3 October 2011
Review_Url: I don't often write reviews, but on this occasion I felt I must for the simple reason this movie really moved me. It's more than just a fighting movie. It's a movie of life. A broken home, a war vet, a family struggling to get by. A good.... no... fantastic all-round movie. Basically the story goes two brothers, one, the war vet, the other a teacher, not able to pay the bills and look after his family the way he wants to, compete in a mma contest. (That's mixed-martial-arts for those of you who don't know.) Yes it may be an obvious outcome, the brothers have to fight each other in the end. But the movie has so many more levels to it than that. All of the leading actors, Joel Edgerton, Nick Nolte, and of course Tom Hardy are all really on-form. Good to see Nick Nolte back on top after an unfortunate couple of years, and that may be why his performance is so good because he can relate to this in real life as he plays a troubled alcoholic. But for me Tom Hardy steals the show. This is an actor who is really on fire just now. It doesn't seem to matter what part he plays, whether it be a prisoner in Bronson (again a fantastic performance) or an mma/war vet he plays it like the part what made for him. He plays this part perfectly and I don't think there is a single actor at the moment who could have played the part better. Go see this. You will not be disappointed.

Author: 21 July 2012
Review: How did this not win the Oscar for best picture?!?!?!
Review_Url: This movie is amazing! No, not amazing, amazing does not even come close to its level of perfection. It was so great, I am forced to make up a word for it.... Scrumtralessent! But really, this is a great movie. Nick Noltie gives the performance of his life in this movie (nearl bringing me to tears at points) and Tom Hardy and Jeol Edgerton give it there all in this Rocky-Esq movie. The level of emotion and power given in this movie is unbelievable!

Author: 27 February 2014
Review_Url: Warrior depicted a great view on the every day lives of two brothers. The fact that they were both raised in a bad environment together really adds to the emotional feeling while i watched this movie. Brendan a man in his early forty's interpreted a struggling man with financial problems with a family to worry about. Tommy, the youngest brother, went A-Wall in the military and has been hiding out in his home town. Tommy had promised a friend that if anything happened to him, Tommy would take care of his friends family. With each brother having a need for a big pay day, the Sparta Tournament drew the brothers together. Their father, a former drunk, tries desperately to communicate with Brendan. Brendan wants nothing to do with the old man due to problems in the past. The boy's father ends up training Tommy for the Sparta Tourney. Both determined to win the tournament, the brothers end up in the finals, fighting each other for the prize money. The emotional spectrum of this event just overwhelms any person/persons watching this movie. Brendan desperately tries to get Tommy to tap out, but Tommy pushes on, determined to win. Brendan puts both of Tommy's arms out of their socket. After crippling his brother, Brendan finally becomes victorious...leading his brother out of the cage....even though Tommy is to be taken into custody by military personnel. The overall feeling that the brothers are finally back together after years of fighting and not talking..it is just outstanding!!! This movie shoots over my expectations for a MMA movie!!

Author: 16 September 2011
Review_Url: Awestruck Expected a good movie, got much more! Many blanks in storyline filled in so well with little dialog. Movie progresses without a pause, pulls you in on all levels. Emotions kept in check by the actors, run rampant throughout the audience. Movie is neither a "Rocky" nor a "Raging Bull," but more like the "The Great Santini" on emotional steroids. It tears at your heart and mind beginning to end! Nick Nolte seems out of his element and somewhat awkward, until his drunken scene hits a grand slam with the unleashing of unsaid demons sequestered in Hell for so long. Facial and body expressions painted under a veil of what seems a still frame filled with only the sounds of ones thoughts, brings a forceful turning point of a dysfunctional father and son (Tom Hardy) to accept and grant absolution in a confessional of a surprising embrace.

Author: 7 May 2014
Review: Breaking through typical MMA fight movies; the real fight is outside the cage
Review_Url: Gavin O'Connor, the director of Warrior, does a fabulous job of making a long movie feel short by grabbing the audience in early scenes while still building suspense along the story line. While other movies follow the cliché 'sport/fight movie' protocol, Warrior puts its own twist on the fighting movie stereotype with extremely powerful acting and revelations of deep inner truths and demons within the characters. Most, if not all, sports films have the same goal; to win. Warrior is no different, it is the quest for a MMA title, but that goal almost comes second hand to other such goals in the movie.

Author: 23 November 2011
Review: Nick Nolte Deserves an Oscar Nom
Review_Url: On the surface, Warrior is about MMA and UFC fighting, but this takes a back seat to the gritty emotion of the relationship between father-son and brother-brother (Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton).

Author: 8 February 2019
Review_Url: One of the best movie of all time!!! Tom Hardy at is best.

Author: 10 May 2014
Review_Url: Even if MMA is not your thing, the acting is especially good. Some have reviewed that the depth of the characters was insufficient, but the characters give enough depth to their characters played to keep the entire film gripping. Nick Nolte excels himself as a former drunk father, conflicted and looking for forgiveness. The dialogue in the living room scene between Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte was so intense and raw when he talks about running away from dad and how his mum lived with poor health with no insurance, you feel uncomfortable just listening to it!! Very touching. This is a movie you will watch time and time again, and with every viewing appreciate more and more the exceptional acting and superb directing. My only slight quibble is some lazy camera work with the fight scenes where the camera drifts onto other angles other than the fight which we all want to see, missing out on prime action. This is particularly true when Tom fights mad dog for the first time in the gym. Also a extended conclusion would of been nice to see the brothers progress to a more resolved setting with their father and each other. But by wanting more it shows how involving the film is. A must see.

Author: 10 December 2011
Review_Url: This movie was so good and I don't know where to begin complimenting it.Great story, great acting, great fighting scenes! A bit unlikely story but it really doesn't matter! I love martial arts movies and there has been a serious lack on good martial arts movies in the recent years but this turned out to be the best movie in it's genre of all times! Author: 23 September 2011
Review_Url: The story is compelling, it is socially apt and the acting is perfect by all....each character of the main ones have their arcs....and you are on the edge of your seat! I hope it wins the Oscar for best ensemble acting....I am afraid that because two of the actors are so buff that some will not appreciate their amazing acting skills throughout this, too.....and it is such a relief to have a feature movie about the working class and not the upper middle class or super riches! Plus, I love the intimacy of the camera....you feel like you are brought so close to the characters so that you can read their nuance, you feel for and love them in all their complexity.. Even though you have to watch some serious bashing in the ring.....('tis why we have eye lids) , the fight scenes are not pulling you into the hurt of it though neither do they escape the physical realities....the sound tracks brings you right into the ring and arena....and they play with the camera work....in varieties of ways to show the story and it is a No BS story. I've seen a few others that had Mid-East Veterans in the story line (Sheridan's the Brothers was one & there is a simplicity and inauthenticity to those (am also thinking of Hurt Locker) or caricatures that are one dimensional) ....this one is complex by not interpreting just sharing the depths and contradictions and it is the best by miles.....no false notes.....despite the preposterousness of the conceit.....my one tiny criticism is that sometimes the back music was a little too crescendo-ish....just a couple of times it pulled you away with its drama....but only for a "bitlet"...They did such interesting work with lens colors' too....darkly tones for the scenes that are emotionally that way....light and bright for others....without being in your face about it.....I really liked!!!! It is so nice to see a GOOOD movie....!!

Author: 3 January 2012
Review: One of the best films of the year!
Review_Url: Now, you may be asking yourself why I declared this to be one of the best films of the year, but gave it a nine out of ten. Not to worry. I do not give out many tens. I reserve those for movies that I deem to be some of the best movies of all time. Nevertheless, upon hearing about this film, I was worried that it would simply be a low-quality rehashing of "The Fighter". When I finally saw this film, I was pleasantly surprised and extremely impressed with everything that they had done. "Warrior" is not just another sports movie that portrays an individual or a team overcoming great odds and finally reaching victory on a high level. This story has multiple layers and satisfies on multiple levels.

Author: 12 December 2014
Review_Url: I have to admit this film, Warrior by Gavin O'Connor (2011), caught me off-guard. My expectations for it wasn't that high, and I just assumed this would be another run of the mill action flick that would only be entertaining at best. I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of emotional weight that became present in the opening scenes and then persisted throughout the remainder of the film. As the story began to unfolded I realized that the Mixed Martial Arts element would only serve as a common interest of the characters and not what the story was all about.

Author: 26 April 2021
Review: Try to do too much much?
Review_Url: The movie tried to do too much. It feels like over half of the movie is dedicated to establishing each brother's background and all of the reasons you should be rooting for that brother--all with the Tom Hardy character barely saying a word. Yet you recognize all along that if either brother has a chance at realistically winning a tournament that includes these 2 brothers and 14 pro fighters, including apparently a couple of the top ones in the world, it's him. The teacher--the film clearly establishes that even as a younger, full-time fighter he was middling at best and that first part of his career ended with him being put into an ambulance and taken to a hospital nearly dead. Now, years older and rusty, but desperate for money, he's capable of taking down some of the best fighters in the world. Hey, at least he takes some punishment along the way. Then after 4 punishing fights in under 2 days, he steps into the ring against his brother, who has walked through 4 fights, easily knocking other fighters out in under 10 seconds each. He's completely fresh. And despite the fact that they're all fighting as middleweights, Hardy and all of the other fighters look like they weigh 20 pounds more than the teacher, easy. At some point during the tournament, the media finds out that Tommy, a war hero, has deserted his Marine unit. But they find this out weeks after a video of him knocking out a top fighter during a sparring session has gone public. The way the media really works, you know that would have come out about an hour after the video did. And the person who gives him away, apparently, who rats him out, is the woman he's trying to win 5 million dollars for... And the Nick Nolte character could have just not appeared in the film at all. Former alcoholic and wife-beater who's been sober for a little under 3 years, does nothing really to earn his sons' forgiveness but hope strongly. The son who seems to hate him more, and actually tells him he has no use for him, is the son who has had him as a trainer for half the movie. And then the guy goes back to drinking. There's no character development, no sympathy build up for the guy at all. You could have just had both kids say they hate the father, have Hardy prepare himself without a trainer, and be done with it. The 4 stars here are because the film actually tried to do something. It fails miserably, though, and isn't really worth the watch. It's 2 hours and 20 minutes and would have needed to be an hour longer to explain things enough to the point where it would even approach being watchable.

Author: 2 July 2017
Review_Url: (Spoiler alert) The movie is fantastic of its kind, and deeply engaging. Two brothers cannot reconcile with their past, nor with their father, which leads into a seemingly permanent family disintegration. The only way to reconcile is to fight in the arena. The plot is conventional, but I give it a thumbs up for the way the movie develops the story. Overall, it's just interesting to watch, don't expect it to be too great, but no mediocre as well.

Author: 19 March 2023
Review_Url: "Warrior" is a gripping sports drama that follows the story of two estranged brothers who find themselves competing against each other in a high-stakes mixed martial arts tournament. Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton deliver powerful performances as the brothers, each with their own personal demons and motivations. The fight scenes are intense and expertly choreographed, showcasing the brutal nature of MMA. The movie also explores themes of family, redemption, and the sacrifices one must make to achieve their dreams. While the plot may feel formulaic at times, the emotional performances and well-executed fight scenes make "Warrior" a must-watch for sports movie fans. Overall, it's a solid movie that delivers both in terms of action and drama.

Author: 9 February 2012
Review_Url: "Numbness" because of the sheer emotional tension of the moment is what I felt during the Silent Catharsis of the three lead characters in the culminating scene. Warrior is a two-track drama of fighting and redemption which, in the initial first hour, methodically reveals the back stories and defines the lead characters of the movie with some pummeling thrown in between. The second half showcases the first rate fighting sequences and arousing emotional moments between the lead characters, making it a "perfect sports movie" in the process.

Author: 27 June 2016
Review: Every sibling should watch this movie
Review_Url: Every time I watch this movie I cry and I have seen the movie more than a couple of times. It is not just a simple sports/fight/hard work & dedication movie. It is more than that---it subtly involves the audience into the tumultuous relation in a family, but how they in their heart love each other. The younger brother wants to fight to prove his point while elder fights to take care of his family and the father is a parent supporting both his sons in his heart and cheering for them. I will not tell you what the story is, I would request you to watch the movie and know how parents and children have an unspoken bond which cannot be broken even if parents hurt us children or we hurt our parents...The last scene where the elder brother has to hit his injured little brother breaks my heart but the love the elder brother shows, oh it will move you to the extent that you might put a call through to your sibling with whom you have not spoken for a long time---I speak from personal experience and hope you all will also feel what I felt.

Author: 20 March 2014
Review_Url: Beautiful, heart-warming, tear-jerking, exciting, EMOTIONAL, uplifting.

Author: 6 January 2012
Review_Url: I watched this movie for Tom Hardy, and his performance was excellent as per usual, so I am being generous in my rating of 7 because of this because it should be more like a 5 or 6. It was just too clichéd. The story was OK, I liked the whole idea of the physics teacher moonlighting in MMA, but it seemed to stretch reality at some points in a film that is trying to be serious. There could of been a few more scenes to the story to add more dimension and give more depth to the characters relationships so it wasn't so clichéd (I think it could be more moving in the end if it had done this - seriously at the end I knew I was supposed to be moved but I wasn't). For example the Dad did some bad stuff, but what exactly, why did they leave? What was the brothers relationship like before all the crap went down? Etc. I am a viewer that definitely doesn't need everything spelled out, and I like when films leave some mystery, but there wasn't enough here to emotionally invest me. And when the film does reveal a hidden secret I was kind of disappointed, it went for the obvious at every turn, The performances in this movie are great, especially Nolte and Hardy, and that is what the film relies on to get our sympathies. With different actors the film would have really not been that good, so I would give the director/story and all other aspects of this film a 5, the acting around an 8, again I am being generous with a 7 rating. It is definitely worth watching, and entertaining, but anyone with half a brain will know what is going to happen in the end half way through the movie, and will even know the plot surprises before they are revealed, because the film goes for the obvious.

Author: 30 April 2014
Review_Url: Thoroughly enjoyed this film, the acting was brilliant from the whole cast, it was raw and heartfelt. Although a predictable end scenario its still a very enjoyable watch. Its been described as a modern day rocky, I would slightly agree, minus the cheese! The training and fight scenes were great and as a BJJ and boxing practitioner I enjoyed watching these bits in the film and it does leave you pumped to go and train! If you buy the DVD there's also some great behind the scenes footage from the film and the story behind the 'tapout' brand. The accents were brilliant from both Tom Hardy (who's British) and Joel Edgerton (oz). Both portrayed convincing American accents. Nick Noltes performance was also brilliant in this. The film also features some known faces from the UFC. All in all I highly recommend watching this. A 10\10 for performances and a 9\10 for the story itself.

Author: 16 December 2011
Review_Url: Jesus Christ. Where to begin. Easily the best film I've seen all year, and I've watched Drive.I was literally on the edge of my seat from start to finish, phenomenal acting from the entire cast made this such a joy to watch. I've seen Never Back Down, which had one good feature; the gorgeous Amber Heard, and that was a shambles of a film about mma. To say this is the Rocky of mma films is an understatement. Stallone cannot touch Hardy or Edgerton in their acting prowess. This is easily the definitive sports film. Every bout, every fight between family members was breathtaking. The only sports movie to come close in terms of sheer brilliance is Coach Carter. When you watch this film you will cheer for both sides, both fighting for just causes and neither for themselves.

Author: 30 May 2014
Review: Sort your family problems but not in an MMA final
Review_Url: I did not have many expectations before seeing this movie and also didn't read the description of the movie. The plot was at many times pretty obvious and many viewers anticipated from the start of the movie that the two brothers will settle family business in this unrealistic MMA final. I won't criticize the fantasy of two underdogs fighting an MMA final, but instead I want to emphasize on the idea of a broken family: on one side was the rebellious Tommy who was blaming everyone around him for his mother's death, while on the other side, Brendan the retired UFC average fighter who picked up a teaching position choosing lower paid but secure employment as a physics teacher, fighting for the biggest motive, not fame, girls or belts, but his family's salvation from bankruptcy. Also the Pop (Nick Nolte) did a great job as the estranged father fighting alcoholism who in the end sees his two boys reunite in an applause filled movie happy ending. At the end I could say, Brendan tamed his furious brother and took up his big brother role again, while Tommy finally could be happy with himself, although losing this match. Actually, I had a feeling (maybe I'm wrong) that Tommy wanted to lose and let the guilt consume him as he never felt being a part of his family.

Author: 17 December 2011
Review: One of the best movies of the last decade
Review_Url: The summary says it all and seriously its one the most emotional and powerful movies i have seen in a long time. The acting by the one and only Nick Nolte as well as the two on-screen brothers Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton is exceptional and simply "feels real". The mix of a broken family with MMA and the struggles of each member to get on with their lives in anyway possible is perfect. With me being a huge fan of UFC and MMA in general i can say that, as far as the fights are concerned, they look completely realistic. I must admit that a was almost moved to tears by that movie, something that, to be honest, has happened to me once or twice in the past. I am trying to see if there are any flaws, but don't seem to find any! I recommend it to everyone, despite their movie taste.

Author: 10 October 2011
Review_Url: "Let me explain something to you: the only thing I have in common with Brendan Conlon is that we have absolutely no use for you." Warrior is brutal, emotional, and touching experience of family drama concept. In the bandage of sports and enjoyable powerful drama, it's very hard to resist this one. Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy gives an depth emotional and sympathy accordance to each characters background. Dazzling cinematography also from Masanobu Takayanagi, which successfully grab the feel and elegant fighting sequence.

Author: 7 January 2012
Review: I can't believe what I've just witnessed......
Review_Url: .....the best movie I've seen in YEARS. I'm shocked. I've always loved MMA, watched so many PPV events I could probably pay a mortgage so I expected a sappy, yet enjoyable sports film. Oh my.....was I ever wrong! Tom Hardy....you've blown my mind. But it's not just him, everyone in this film is so believable, I forgot I was watching a movie. I laughed, smiled, chuckled, frowned, held my breath (alot), literally jumped off the couch yelling stuff, held my breath some more, and felt tears well up in my eyes. And that was before the ending!!! The ending is epic, in my opinion. I've read other reviews stating an opinion that it would have been better if certain things happened but I don't agree. I refuse to put spoilers in here but the ending is perfect just the way it is. It's more like watching reality TV the way it's done and like I've already said, I totally forgot I was watching a movie, it's so believable. Please, females who read this......do NOT pass this up because it looks like a guy film. This is like a chick flick wrapped in testosterone. Besides, the stars are gorgeous. This is definitely going in my Blu Ray collection and I'm inviting everyone I know to come over and watch it.

Author: 18 September 2011
Review: A Final Act with a Powerful Punch
Review_Url: Some of the best fighting scenes I've seen in a movie. As I watched, I found myself flinching with every blow, wriggling around in my seat delightfully enraptured during these truly epic scenes. They are by far the best part of the film, and that's saying a lot. All the actors are outstanding and the emotional build-up at the end is so fantastic and gripping, that it's hard to put into words. Granted, the first half is very slow and a little cliché. Once you get to the halfway point the movie SKYROCKETS. By the beautiful, heart-wrenching, touching, action- packed, magnificent, and overall EXHILARATING, final act, you'll have forgotten all that might have been possibly slow from the beginning, for you will be truly captivated. The final minutes will make you want to weep and cheer all at the same time. I've never seen such a huge take off in a movie as this one, for the second half is just plain brilliant. Tom Hardy is a machine in this movie, a ball of tightly wounded rage and hurt that his opponents unfortunately feel as he viciously unleashes it ALL in the ring. While his brother, Joel Edgerton, is more stable, still dealing with his own heavy problems as well, but like his fighting style, is thoughtful and deliberate in his decisions. I'm tempted to say these brothers make up your protagonist and antagonist, but then I would be sorely mistaken. You have your clear-cut hero, Edgerton the good-hearted school teacher trying to save his family and home due to financial troubles, and your ANTI-hero (most of the time my favorite characters in movies) Hardy, the dark, complex, and untrusting war "hero" that cannot let go of his tragic past from both war and his earlier home life. Both these actors carry the film, both equally engrossing, and their inevitable confrontation at the end is powerful, brutal, and breathtaking. Nick Nolte is especially engaging, playing the formerly severe alcoholic father begging for redemption from his two sons. (I sense a possible Oscar nomination for him) Overall, this movie is brutal while thoroughly uplifting and touching at the same time, and it is speckled with some surprisingly humorous moments. It creates quite a build up, and the ending trumps and exceeds all possible expectations. The fight scenes are BEAUTIFULLY choreographed and are, once again, some of the best fight scenes I've seen in a movie. If your not an MMA fan you will become one after this movie. If you are an MMA fan, you will lose your mind with delight during this movie. Overall, the first half may be hard to stay with, but the movie eventually transcends into a gripping, emotional, heart-racing, and brilliant tale of two brothers with stakes higher than you can imagine. This one will have you on the edge of your seat, whilst you hold back tears. Warrior is a must see.

Author: 25 February 2022
Review_Url: Warrior is one of the few movies I'll watch that will bring me to tears by the end every single time. Despite the majority of the movie featuring fighting scenes, the movie is really about family and love. All three leads deliver amazing performances, each bringing their own viewpoint of a family that was torn and broken apart many years ago. By the end of the film, you'll feel like a member of the Conlon family as you relate in some way or another to their trauma and ultimately their love for each other.

Author: 14 September 2012
Review: Fairly clichéd sports film elevated by performances of power.
Review_Url: 'Warrior,' has previously been compared to 2010's 'The Fighter,' an easy comparison to make. Both are centered on professional fighting, yet the true bulk of the story comes in it's portrayal of a highly dysfunctional family. However, whereas I found 'The Fighter,' to be quite overrated and fairly dull, 'Warrior,' is not. Primarily because of a holy trinity of incredible performances from its three male leads, Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton and Nick Nolte. Whereas the film is fairly conventional in its plot and direction, the sheer power of these three truly elevates the film to something great.

Author: 31 May 2022
Review: Good film, but not a masterpiece
Review_Url: Many call this film a masterpiece, I disagree. It is good movie but not without faults. From a story perspective, there are a few things that didn't add up and others was just too cliche. However, there are parts of this movie that really hit hard emotionally and thats due to the incredible performances of the three main actors. Nick Nolte steals every scene and both Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton were flawless in both the drama and especially the action sequences. The fight scenes are probably the best shot and edited from any that I can recall in recent history. The look and feel of these fights added a layer of realism that kept me engaged until the credits rolled.

Author: 28 November 2015
Review_Url: The story is good, but I must admit that I am very disappointed with the course of this movie.I don't care for happy end,I really get upset when i saw that the teacher who wasn't fought for several years win this competition.When opponents hits him,it is like they hitting a rock.When Tommy Conlon and Koba(professional fighter) fight with other opponents they falls after only one punch,but when they fight with the Brendan Conlon they punched him a hundred times in the head,but he looks like he is just got up,and ready for work.It is impossible to down him.Maybe if they had drown some bulldozer in the cage they would have knocked him down,but I doubt.Common men,give me some reality here.I'm really start to thinking to train boxing next two months and challenge Klitschko,it is a very ''real'' for me to win that match.I just want reality in some parts.Only for that I gave this movie a lousy mark.

Author: 2 May 2021
Review_Url: The beauty of this movie lays within its originality.

Author: 29 December 2011
Review: One of the best films of this year!!!
Review_Url: After seeing the trailer to Warrior many times, I wanted to see this movie from the start. When I bought it on DVD, I was shocked of this film. I love all performances from Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton, Jennifer Morrison and Nick Nolte. The story line behind the film wasn't any ordinary where one guy loses everything in the beginning and battles back over obstacles at the end and rise about everything. You get many stories through this whole film where Nick Nolte is a recovering alcoholic, Joel Edgerton and Jennifer Morrison are a married couple with two girls and they are just like any other American family. Working two to three jobs to help their kids and doctor bill as well. Then there comes Tom Hardy's character where he plays a Marine that goes AWOL after his brother in arms in killed and he saves a fellow marine in the process. He returns home and asks the help of his father to train him for an MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) tournament. By far, this movie has Oscar buzz flowing around it. Gavin O'Connor coming from making Miracle to this is a big step forward in his career. I just liked it cause within 15 minutes of the movie, there is a fight.

Author: 17 July 2014
Review_Url: Let me be clear about one thing first, this is by far the best wrestling movie I've ever seen. This movie has some of the most intimidating and breathtaking fighting scenes that you cant get to watch in real fights. When the fight commentator confirms that 'Tommy Riordan definitely is real', I figured this really hyped up Gavin O'Connor movie Warrior definitely is real. Daron Aronofsky's The Wrestler (2008) was the fighting movie of my mode with more of life, emotions than the fighting, Micky Rourke acted his best in that Oscar nominated movie. Paddy Conlon reminded me of that old fighter re-entering his life with a lot of difficulties. After awhile Tommy and Brendan Conlon and their twisted relationship resembles another two brothers in The Fighter (2010). But none of them mentioned above are worthy to be the epic one, Warrior, I would say has everything to be remembered as the finest wrestling movie ever made.Although there is a lot of cage in this movie but for me, the story is beyond the cage. I have no say about that war hero part, I think everybody knows that the Iraq War is no heroic war to be fought. People of America need to fight a greater war than that.

Author: 17 January 2013
Review: if in the end he didn't tapped and won with a broken shoulder it was awesome movie
Review_Url: I've noticed a lot of people complaining that the ending spoils the film and is clichéd because the underdog and not the better fighter wins and i am one of them, if you take out the last half hour from the movie it was perfect 10 on 10 but a fighter like Kobe with such experience lost to a school teacher , i cant digest that and in all of his fights he was taking the beating still won all of them in a similar fashion. and apart from Kobe and two brothers it was evident none of the other fighters had any chance because they had no limelight in movie, so top16 fighters in world and you come with this? fighting scenes were good and real in starting but in the end it was shown in movie that you cant beat that teacher because it does not matter the amount of beating he will have he will still stand up and win by submission somehow 3 times in a row , i wondered why other opponent were so dumb to not to submit him when they were so dominant. and why the hell tommy was not able to take the teacher down in a fashion like he destroyed his other opponents ? just because you wanted to show a good fight between brothers in end? these things are so away from reality + the format why brothers were not scheduled to fight earlier or Kobe fight with brothers in start ? as if format was also tricked . only plus point is the story other than fighting.

Author: 7 October 2011
Review: Rocky never had it this good....
Review_Url: The story is nothing new, its the underdog's rise but done in a fresh way from two different perspectives. It is exciting and very well done and has a modern twist on the old training montage. The performances; a tour-de-force. I would say that appropriately describes Tom Hardy's performance here. Wow. He is unbelievable. A dark and troubled character who is wound so tight that once he steps in the ring he becomes an animal, with the haunted look of all your favourite psycho's down the years. He has to be getting Oscar buzz for this. Nolte too is fantastic, a recovered alcoholic and so troubled by his past and his olive branches which he extends to his estranged sons get torched without even being entertained. It is an understated performance but very powerful. Egerton is almost the boy next door, driven to fight to support his family, he blends in alongside Hardy and Nolte but so would anyone else. He handles his emotional and fighting scenes very well, without being clichéd. Again, he is understated.

Author: 11 December 2011
Review_Url: What a script. What performances! Nick Nolte is the icing on the bloody cake! You cannot help but get drawn into this tale of a family gone wrong. It's raw and visceral with a poetic human touch. Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy are fantastic as the brothers bonded by blood. And Nick Nolte where have you been lately?. Terrific as the father seeking redemption. A great supporting role by Jennifer Morrison as the vulnerable wife too. The ultimate question is "What sacrifice would you make for your family ?" I challenge you to not feel every crack, crunch and thwack and not be misty eyed at the same time by the end. It's in my top 5 of all time because its the humanity of the story that runs so deep.

Author: 20 February 2012
Review_Url: It's rare for me to get so emotionally involved with characters in a movie, but this is a film that did it for me. If you don't already know, the film is about two brothers who end up fighting each other for $5,000,000. There are so many things that this film got right, that I have no idea how it didn't get nominated for best picture. The story was great, the dialogue was excellent, and the characters felt very real. The back stories behind the two fighters makes it so you want to root for both of them and when the end comes you don't know who to root for. I have never watched a fighting film where I had no idea who I wanted to root for until watching Warrior. Nick Nolte played an excellent role as the once alcoholic father, and Tom Hardy was excellent as Tommy. When I first saw Tom Hardy in Inception, I thought of him playing roles that are meant to be sarcastic, however this movie changed that opinion. His character was isolated, angry, and cold hearted and Hardy captured it perfectly. I would put his character in the same category as Christian Bale in The Fighter. This movie had everything that I was looking for and more. It had awesome fighting scenes, emotions, and great character development and dialogue. I would highly recommend this movie even to people who don't like MMA. It's hard to watch this movie and not become emotionally involved with them and for me, that's what makes a great film. In my opinion this is a better movie than The Fighter, and one of the best films I have seen in a long time.

Author: 29 December 2011
Review_Url: when the average rating of the movie is 8.3 u already knew that the movie is brilliant.

Author: 30 October 2018
Review_Url:
Warrior: The title and cover let assume this film might be some uninteresting, run-of-the-mill fighting film.
The truth is: It is some highly underrated story about the brutal, inner fight between two estranged brothers. With their entrance into a MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) tournament they come to terms with each other and their lives.

Author: 30 January 2012
Review_Url: I usually write very long winded, very analytic psychosomatic reviews of films. However, words just don't do this one justice.

Author: 28 December 2011
Review: Not a feel good movie, and awful camera work
Review_Url: I'm a big UFC fan and have started to watch all the MMA movies I could find. I went into watching this movie completely ready to enjoy the story line, the fight scenes, and whatever other magic this film would have to offer. That is, I was ready to like it. Well, sad to say, this movie disappoints on many levels. It starts out fine, with good character development, the hint of some intrigue, the modern theme of foreclosure, and it seems like the movie will be good. The problem is, the way the story unfolds, it definitely is not a feel good movie. Of course, it's obvious to everyone where it's headed, so that's another disappointment - there is no surprise as to how the tournament will turn out, except for who will win. Ultimately, I expected some sort of resolution where both guys win - meaning, one guy wins the fights, yes, but both guys come out winners in real life. The director does the best he can to get to that conclusion, but I think it's just yucky by the end. How can I really feel good after seeing the final fight? Not knowing how the prize money, which has good intentions for both guys, will be used or split? Of course, there had to be the brother reconciliation, that was to be expected, and that part was OK. The two things that really made this movie a stinker are these. The MMA scenes are awful. Just terrible. Why? The camera work! It's dizzying, moves way too fast, there is never any focus, and it all just feels, well, not even frenetic, just like it was the best that could be done to splice together bits of the acted fighting to make it feel intense and high action. I had to look away for parts of the fight because the camera work was so bad, and certainly, you get no sense of what is developing in the fight. Of course, they can't show even a full 5-minute round, but the editing down to what it ended up with was terrible. Then, the final part where one brother gets injured badly - forget it, right then and there, it's just pointless. At least if they'd ended the final fight at the 3rd round at that injury, there would be a semblance of reality in terms of how MMA fights really wind up. The second thing, now, is that everyone kept saying this was the next Rocky feel-good underdog movie. It wasn't. The reason being, by the time you get to the final fight, the whole lead-in is awful, and you feel conflicted knowing brothers are going to fight. How does that feel good? Of course you know why - because the brothers will reconcile. So there should be triumph. But there isn't, not to me. And how could there be? One brother has to lose, and he gets devastatingly injured in a very similar fashion to the way that Antonio Nogueria was in real life (granted, that was after this movie was released). Rocky feels good at the end. Rudy feels good. This movie does not. I usually feel very confident relying on IMDb movie review ratings, and I could see this coming in at 6.5 to 7.0, but no way it's 8.3 in my book. If you're an MMA fan, and if you have any expectation of a feel good Rocky type movie, forget it. This movie turns out to be quite disappointing. Better: Never Back Down 2. That movie isn't as high production quality, but it's better overall to me.

Review_Url: First of all - this is mostly a drama flick. If you disregard the "MMA" part of the movie, it becomes a cliché drama with all the stereotypical family problem scenarios Hollywood has to offer.

Author: 15 December 2011
Review: Warrior is a good fight flick but might make you cry if you have daddy issues
Review_Url: Helloooo!! Just checked out this sleeper and it was OK. Cinematography and themes are similar to the fighter but the acting is no where near and the mma thing isn't as big of a deal as you would think. The main point of the movie is the effects of alcoholism on a family. Nolte is great as always as a former boxer and wrestling trainer to his sons. After years of drinking his family is torn apart. His two sons hate him and they all go their separate ways. One to war,,,One to a family. Through hardships in both their lives they turn to ring matches for financial gain. Thus a modern day kumite bloodsport style movie is born. Of curse its tapout mma stuff and not backbreaking action. The best parts of the movie are the scenes between Tom Hardy kicking some major ass and not showing emotion or he's making Nick Nolte feel like a complete p.o.s. for being such a bad father in the past. This is really a "BRO" movie. Some OK fights but pretty predictable. Redbox it up,,,,but could be an OK present for an mma fan that has daddy issues

Author: 16 May 2012
Review_Url: Movie is loosely related to the Parable of the prodigal son,set in a modern everyday American setting.This movie is seen from the eyes of the two brothers.Both needed forgiveness and love.The "brotherhood" of belonging to the navy or army can never replace the true bond of a family. Even though the younger brother spurned the forgiveness of the elder brother but eventually that was what he was really seeking.His pride and anger prevented him from talking the problem out with his brother.He best expressed his challenges in the 'ring'.The 'art of fighting' was a gift given to the two sons by their father.It is in the 'ring' they will find redemption and love,which we all long for. Now will the elder brother spurn the love and forgive his father? On the whole a great movie

Author: 4 January 2016
Review: Unrealistic, overrated, still an enjoyable film.
Review_Url: "Warrior" is a decent sports drama that for some reason gets a massive amount of undeserved credit for things it actually fails at. And seeing how it's getting 9 and 10 out of 10 left and right, I feel like I need to show a different point of view.

Author: 23 May 2014

Author: 31 October 2011
Review_Url: This movie is fascinating.You will be in complete shock after this movie.Story is full of emotions and you don't have to be ashamed if you let a few tears after this movie.Great performances by actors especially Nick Nolte as a father of two sons,Tom Hardy is incredible in his role certainly the best role of his career,Joel Edgerton is also very good.All three actors put up some of the most convincing performances in their career.The Fighter is a good movie,Oscar nominated movie but Warrior is ten times better than The Fighter.Father Paddy (Nick Nolte) is former alcoholic who is trying to reach out for his sons for forgiveness of being a family wreck.His older son former Marine Tommy Conlon (Tom Hardy) is a war hero who is suffering through PTSD decide that he wants to fight in Sparta and give the prize money to a wife of his fallen friend Manny.Younger son Brendan Conlon (Joel Edgerton) is a former MMA fighter,now a Physics teacher who faces financial problems with his house and is slowly getting back into the mix by competing in underground fights. But the education system finds out about his underground fights and he is suspended without pay,so he uses this to train full time, and compete in Sparta.The movie had a specific way to get emotionally attached to characters and to know them really good.This movie is a truly respectable candidate for the Academy Award.My advice is that you leave anything you doing and run to the cinema,you wont regret it.This movie will be carved in your memory because of his incredible emotional story and incredible roles of actors especially Tom Hardy,Nick Nolte and Joel Edgerton.Once again i have to say it is truly amazing movie!!!

Author: 2 January 2012
Review_Url: I wasn't expecting much from this movie. I knew it would have good fighting scenes but that's about it - boy was I wrong! At the beginning it seemed a bit boring but just stick around and keep watching you won't regret it. During every fight I was literally at the edge of my seat and so into it. The plot was deep and so were the actors and combined with the fighting it was all INTENSE. Loved the movie, I wished we could've seen more at the end or maybe I'm just greedy and always want more. One of the best action movies I've watched in a while, loved it. Definitely 10/10. halfway through I was already recommending it to people to go watch it; yes it's THAT good!

Author: 27 August 2012
Review: The untold tale of love and bravery
Review_Url: The "Warrior" is justified to its fullest extent by the story which revolves around 2 brother and their father all spitted away yet woven together by the web of love. It is a story about two brothers who split ways in their teens because of their father's alcoholism. Younger brother Tommy departed with mom but elder brother Brandan decided to stay back for her girl-friend. This creates a rift between the brothers which resurfaces and dissolves when they clash against each other in arena of death and life.

Author: 26 June 2012
Review_Url: The film follows two fighters and their families as they enter the fast big money martial arts (MMA) competition, Sparta. Brendan doing it for the family (Joel Edgerton) and a seemingly brutal Tommy who is looking for a payday (the suddenly ubiquitous Tom Hardy)with Nick Nolte as Paddy , a sad, reformed drunk of a father and we have the basic elements of another run of the mill sporting movie. Or at least that's how it starts. It examines family relationships and regret and faces the terrible truths when some wounds just cannot be healed by forgiveness once it is too late.

Author: 21 June 2012
Review_Url: Warrior is one of those films, you've got nothing to do on a Friday night, so you take a trip to the video store (even though your getting a DVD) and you pick it up and think, I'll give this a try.

Author: 25 November 2011
Review_Url: This movie has a great story that will keep you intrigued throughout the entire length. The actors Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton each lead separate captivating stories as the brothers and Nick Nolte brings it home as the once abandoned, aloof, and drunken father trying to find a way back into the lives of the men. Admittedly, I was wary of this movie because it has what I believe is a predictable ending which is the only downfall but the drama kept the movie alive nevertheless. This movie will definitely be included in my list of movie favorites and I just found two new favorite actors as well. Lastly, I feel that it's important to note that yes this movie does have a character bias which brings it down a point for me along with it's cut-off style ending but all in all an 8 out of 10.

Author: 23 November 2011
Review_Url: From hatred and apathy to forgiveness and re-unity, the feeling of Tommy carried the audience through every conversation and body language with Dad and Brendon. They "were" a family, and in the end, they finally became a family again.

Author: 21 November 2018
Review: Brilliant movie, ruined by the trailer
Review_Url:
If you've not seen anything about this movie, do yourself a favour and watch it right now but please don't watch the trailer.
Great performances, a gripping story and engaging direction, some of the fight scenes might not be to everyone's taste but overall this is a fantastic film that unfortunately flew under the radar (and had an awful trailer that revealed way too much)

Author: 29 December 2011
Review_Url: I guess I could go into explaining the true meaning behind the movie, the spiritual redemption and healing. Challenges and obstacles that appear before each character emotionally and physically to shut up some of the critics of this movie. But I wont. The bottom line for me is that when I get those goose bumps, or the hair raises on the back of my neck, or the intense feeling of wanting to jump out of my seat while I am watching a movie such as this one, then my own emotion tells the story that this was indeed one of the best movies I have seen. My only gripe is, I wish it was a little longer eg fight scenes and the hint of European accent during the chat between Brendon and his father.

Author: 15 February 2012
Review: Hell yeah! This is a movie!!!
Review_Url: In an era where most of the movies are rather disappointing, or even worse over-rated and they create a hype when they are usually pointless and boring, this film has you seating in the edge of your seat. Full of emotions, with not many extraneous scenes, gives you an adrenaline rush like no other recent movie. Good acting, believable characters and great fighting scenes. Good soundtrack too. I also liked how the back-story is created rather slowly and the pieces of the puzzle come together comfortably and are not pushed to the viewer just to get it over with. It left me feeling mixed emotions, unlike similar movies, it also made me think about the whole picture not just the fights.

Author: 9 April 2012

Author: 17 March 2012
Review_Url: Just saw a sneak peek of Warrior. All I can saw is WOW! Great film. Great performances. The characters are deep and believable and the story will probably have you leaving the theater in tears.

Author: 19 September 2011
Review_Url: I don't love MMA; I like MMA and this movie was hands down the best movie I have seen in 3 years. Yes years. It is that good. Great acting, drama, plot, and back story. Amazing editing in the fight scenes. Riviting and gritty, sad and triumphant. Awesome patriotic hero side to the movie coupled with dysfunction and addiction. This movie is a true masterpiece. If I could vote this a 11 out of 10 I would. hope this gets the Oscar nod because it is without a doubt the best movie of the year. The audience in the theater including myself were cheering out loud in some of the fight scenes. It was great. Moving. I am a straight mans man and I actually had a tear come to my eyes in some of the scenes with Nolte and Hardy (in the casino) and also in the victory's in the cage. AMAZING MOVIE. Run, don't walk, RUN to go see it. You will be inspired.

Author: 22 November 2011
Review_Url: I've been reading reviews on IMDb for years now, but I have never felt compelled to rate a movie on here because I was always content with the outcome. So here I am, with an account just to give this movie 10 stars. It deserves much more than the measly 8.3 it has at the moment. This was the underdog film of the year and deserves picture of the year, I'm not going to go on about what it's about because there are already reviews on here that touch on that subject. But just know this, it's touching, it's emotional, it's inspiring and it's about forgiveness and love, something that rarely moves me in cinema.

Author: 11 August 2015
Review_Url: I first watched this movie on Netflix and didn't really know what to expect as I hadn't looked at any reviews beforehand. After watching it, I went on to buy it for only £3 (Which is a bargain). It starts off a little slow but it was definitely worth it in the end. What I mainly liked about this movie, is that it has a lot of background information to the main characters, which really makes them interesting and most importantly memorable. When it gets going, its almost impossible to move your eyes away from the screen as it keeps you gripped at all times. This is partially because anything could happen at any given moment. I simply cant see how people can give bad reviews for this masterpiece. The makers have done a really good job by creating a truly outstanding movie. I strongly recommend to anybody who hasn't already seen it because for only £3, its a crime not to.

Author: 11 December 2011
Review: Great movie, great acting, and it's always fun yelling "TAP!" at the TV.
Review_Url: Ahh, been a while since I've seen a movie even worth talking about. And unfortunately, by what I've read here about it being a box office flop is distressing. Now, that said, I've never even seen a trailer for this movie, until I actually saw it. Regardless, amazing movie, it helps if you are an MMA fan, but if you aren't, you're forgiven. As the movie first and foremost is a drama and a family driven drama at that. I really liked the fact that the whole story wasn't just dumped in our laps at the outset and we would have to follow whatever storyline the writers had envisioned. The grey areas and ambiguity let us make up our own mind and we could still change our opinions as more of the story was told. Great performances by all, Nick Nolte, I bought all of it, I felt the pain and frustration and hope that he was portraying, great job. Brendan, perfect as the regretful and loving husband and father, doing what he has to to get by. Tommy, the angry, guilty, quiet and yet amazingly caring guy. Again, great job. There should be at the very least, best movie award nomination awards for this. It's a modern day reiteration of the classic Rocky movie, with a few more details. Stories excellent, great acting, extremely well written and directed. Big thumbs up. Must watch.

Author: 11 October 2011
Review_Url: First of all I would like to say that I am not a fan of sports or fighting movies in the first place. Rocky did not interest me as that it just not my type of film and I have to say that I was reluctant to go and view this movie BUT.... I was extremely and pleasantly surprised whilst I was exiting the cinema after seeing this film. This movie is not just a movie for hardcore UFC fans but it is a movie for anyone who enjoys films altogether. The fight scenes that take place throughout this movie are brilliantly choreographed and they will take your breath away. The plot line is very well directed and the cinematography is outstanding in some instances |e.g the montaged training scene|. The actors did fantastic in their roles but I would have loved to see more of Nick Nolte.

Author: 3 December 2011
Review_Url: Awesome Movie..........Although it is a Sports Genre movie it tells the story of a Family with each member having a Hard time in their lives. The whole cast was Superb Especially Tom Hardy who will just take you by surprise with this performance after what you saw of him in Inception. Each and every scene has been shot perfectly. you will feel the emotions during the confrontation of the two brothers for the first time when one tries to Introduce his family and the Response from Tom. The Fight scenes looked real. The Performance by Nick Nolte and Joel was good as well. All in all a Great movie probably the best in 2011 so far.
