Author: 12 March 2023
Review_Url:
So many good things to say. What a cast. The way I see it, once those brothers come together again they will be unbreakable. Tom Hardy was great with showing so much emotional pain but with the strength to hang on without destroying himself. Instead he found what felt like real family. Someone he could love and trust in the military. His performance for me was so telling. He became Tommy Reardin. But losing his fallen Conrad drops him to his knees and overwhelms him with anger. But at the same time he's focused on helping his friends family, he promised. Then if you thought Tommy's determination to fight his way back was so impressive, we watch Brenden come to realize his family's well being is in jeopardy and decides to do what he knows will hurt his wife, and possibly him. The interaction they ( Tommy and Brenden)had outside of the hotel was brilliant. So much emotion and raw pain that quickly turns to anger. Leaves you feeling that what Evers broken with these 2 brothers is not gonna get fixed. But, they've gotten to a path that requires both of them to finish. Their father wants to help. All of them survivors. We see one display of strength and courage after another until we see the one we may not wanna see. How can this end well. The movies been so great to this point, how will they not ruin it. I'm gonna tell you. It's a fairytale. Those boys come together. Tommy gets to unload all that hate and hurt while Brenden just wants to survive. Save his family, which he does. He saves his brother, and his family. Someone needs to produce an episode of "where are they now"
Where are those boys now? I think Brenden split his winnings with Tommy and Tommy helped his friends wife.

Author: 18 June 2019
Review_Url: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

Author: 7 August 2019
Review_Url: There is just no way a physics teacher with a few weeks of training could even be in the final of the greatest mma championship in the world let alone win it especially after the beating he took each round. There is just no way. The movie was promising at the start but ruined in the end.

Author: 27 October 2012
Review: One of my favorites. Intense, emotional, moving.
Review_Url: Great story. Shows the ugly affects of alcoholism...struggle of tragedies, and sorrows, and family relationships. If I had to choose between this or Rocky, I'd watch Warrior. Underrated in my opinion. People carry around hurts for many years. This movie gives a glimpse of the pain of carrying around those hurts vs the release found in forgiveness. I thought the fight scenes were intense, the characters very believable, and the story very moving. Anger, bitterness, jealousy, hurt, hardship, drive, fight, discipline, will, compassion, forgiveness, love...its all in this movie. All except sex...thank you. I enjoyed watching it with my sons.

Author: 8 June 2021
Review_Url: Acting skills may be exceptional. 'Warrior' is more of too many films which continue promoting Testosterone Poisoning. Alcoholics have always been linked with wife-beating. Why taint the sport of Boxing by associating it with alcohol? Ali did quite a lot to bring ethics TO Boxing. Boxing isn't the only sport with the message of Gender-control. Until and unless perspectives of women are provided scenes & scripts central to the camera lens, reality isn't acknowledged. Boxing should always include both genders.

Author: 7 November 2012
Review_Url: When I sat down to watch this movie, I said because of Tom Hardy (I saw him in This means war, Inception), but when the movie started I said: oh my god. The story is simple, but really good. I have seen a lot of navy-movies, but none of it was this fantastic! SPOILER!!! The actors play was wonderful, and when the final was on screen, I said Brendan will win because Tommy hands over the match - but NOT! And that's the best part of the movie... It's all about the brotherhood, how the two brothers try to understood each other, our father, our lives etc... I sat down to watch Hardy, but when the movie finished I said: just that short movie? WHY??? I love this! 10/10

Author: 11 September 2011
Review_Url: Warrior was a fantastic experience for all ages. If you're interested in a good story and fighting, it's definitely a movie for you. It was one of the few movies this year that I was very excited for, and I can honestly say it was totally worth it. I wanna see it again! It was very heartfelt and emotional, it really brought my feelings into action. I was touched by it. And the fighting was brutal, but very well played out. I got so into it I wanted to start cheering in the middle of the movie, and your adrenaline builds up and I was getting pumped! They also made a very good cast selection for the roles. It was well done. I really recommend people go see it!

Author: 20 December 2011
Review_Url: I have never written a review on IMDb, even though I reference this sight at least 5 times a day. I remember seeing the preview for this movie in the theater and knew I wanted to see it. However, it was gone from the theater in a blink. I just watched it on DVD and am simply stunned! This was one of the best movies I have ever seen. In the very beginning it seemed like it was going to be one of those low budget, small town movies that I may end up turning off. 10 minutes in I knew I was wrong. This story takes off and doesn't let up. It has a long running time but in no way drags. The acting between the brothers and father (Nick Nolte!) was just right for the story. By the end I was almost moved to tears (I don't think that has happened since Saving Private Ryan.) For the record, this movie KILLED 'The Fighter' that got so much hype last year. I'm sure lots of people will disagree with me on that one but just watch it for yourself. I will be buying this one on DVD!

Review_Url: It's a long time ago I saw a movie this good. it's a mix of emotion and action that makes it this great you won't be bored because there is always something happening.

Review_Url: This movie is amazing, i was not expecting much when i put it on, but i was blown away by what i saw.

Author: 26 March 2021
Review_Url: The most underated movie of the past decade. It has everything you want a combat sports movie to have but also carries an investing and emotional story. Please watch this movie you will not be disappointed.

Author: 20 March 2012
Review: see it, you won't be disappointed
Review_Url: Actually, when i planned on seeing the movie, i thought it would be another fighting movie about a guy, with a questionable history, who has issues with another guy, while dealing with a girl. And when you strip it down to the basics, it is exactly like that. But then you realize that the main storyline is the one about 'the other guy', and that is his brother. The acting is good, way above average. But i do have a problem with the way Tom Hardy is shown in the movie. His behavior and fighting style suggests that he is a barbarian, with an IQ below 50. Maybe it was the directors' vision, but i would have done it slightly different. Nick Nolte is amazing. He deserves a good role like this, a chance he gets not often enough. Frank Grillo and Joel Edgerton do a great job. And then, the fighting itself: it's more than just a fighting movie. I can read in the other reviews that comparisons with Rocky are often made. They are both good films in the genre. Rocky is a huge icon in movie history, known to man and child for over 35 years. But it's more a 'drama' than a 'fighting movie'. Warrior (for me) tilts the balance a bit in the other direction. The difference and variation in fighting styles of the contenders is welcome. Joel (Brendan) has clearly a another approach in the cage. I enjoyed it, no doubt about it. Nevertheless, a huge merit for director, producer and actors: one of the best movies i've seen in a while. Go and see it (or rent it)!

Author: 21 December 2011
Review_Url: YES, WOOOW! that would be enough said.

Review_Url: This movie turned out to be more than what I expected. There is a Rocky-Esq feel but in no way does it hinder the movie. The acting was great, Tom Hardy I personally feel had an Oscar worthy performance. Joel most likely had a breakthrough for his career, he was great. Author: 7 December 2015
Review_Url: I was surprised by this film. Very intense and exciting. I didn't think I was going to get hooked as I did. The film keeps you tense up till the end. The way the story is told makes you connect with the characters. The role of brothers between Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton might make you feel identified if you ever fought with your brother. I think the role of Nick Nolte is very well done. Jennifer Morrison acts very little, but their role is well achieved. I think they could have improved a little Tommy military background history, and the end could have had a more detailed outcome as how each story ends. But They leave an open end. I fully recommend this movie, very entertaining, very well acted.

Author: 29 September 2012
Review_Url: The story started off pretty good but got more and more unbelievable to the point of being ridiculous at the end. The acting and dialog were good overall, especially Nick Nolte. But the melodrama got so thick at the end I could barely stand it. It also started to get really tiresome listening to Tommy grunt and snarl at everyone all hunched over like a cave man. And, what a surprise, he turns out to be a war hero who never took credit for saving someone's life so the whole crowd is cheering for him. That by itself, okay; but added to all the other unbelievable stuff; no. If the writers had consulted a group of high school boys, they probably would have recommended that. Then how the fight turned out in the end: could it have even been attempted to make it more dramatic and moving? What else could have been thrown in there to aim for a higher crescendo to make it by far the very most dramatic sports movie of all time--since that seems to have been what they were aiming for? Maybe the other guy's daughter could have been taken hostage and he has to win to save her life, but at the same time Tommy actually had organ damage and would die if he was hit again. Sound pretty good? I mean, that would be really dramatic. It is possible to overdo something so that it just becomes dumb, and despite the good elements of this film, it could not have been much more overdone in the end.

Author: 9 June 2013
Review: Don't second guess or ask questions...just watch it.
Review_Url: I put this on everything I love and stand for, I was NOT going to watch this movie. UNTIL, my boyfriend asked me to. And I thank God he did. This movie has changed my life. You need to take a bathroom break before the movie even begins. GRAB EVERYTHING YOU NEED AND MAYBE EVEN A FEW TISSUES. THESE WRITERS, DIRECTORS, ACTORS , AND PRODUCES ALL NEED AN AWARD. I LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS MOVIE AND I CAN'T EVEN BELIEVE I NEVER HEARD OF IT UNTIL TONIGHT [ July 9th, 2013 ] I am going to find this movie, buy it (maybe even two copies just in case someone steals it) and show it to my kids. This is a movie for absolutely EVERYONE. I will forever brag about this wonderful movie. It sets up a story (not too fast and not too slow) and it HONESTLY keeps you on the edge of your seat! Exactly Right After watching it, I encourage you to write a review of your own!

Author: 20 October 2013
Review_Url: For those of you who expect 'Warrior' to be a some sort of fighting extravaganza like the ones Sylvester Stallone or Jean-Claude van Damme used to make, let me get one thing straight: 'Warrior' is a drama about a dysfunctional family. The mother is dead. Her two sons haven't spoken to each other for years and contact with the father is avoided by both of them at all cost. The MMA-contest is but the scenery in which they stand face to face. It easily could have been a tennis tournament or a beauty pageant! That doesn't mean the fighting isn't there. Off course it is. People not familiar with the term MMA are in for a treat. People that follow MMA on a regular basis will probably find the various styles that MMA has to offer not extremely well distilled. What makes 'Warrior' into a fine piece of cinema is not the story as it is seen before in other movies. The performances however of Joel Egderton, Tom Hardy and especially Nick Nolte take it to a higher level and therefore 'Warrior' is definitely worth watching.

Author: 26 December 2011
Review: Wonderful movie on so many levels!
Review_Url: My family and I just watched this movie and I had to join IMDb just to write this review. After seeing a review about this movie on NPR, I put it on the list of movies my husband & I wanted to watch. Even with that good review, I wasn't sure what to expect: Rocky, Fighter, etc. It's a long movie, over 2 hours, and the fighting doesn't really start to happen till over half way through but that may be the best part about it. Because the fight wouldn't mean anything without knowing the history of these men. This movie moved me to tears, it made me cheer, it made me nervous for the fighters, it made me want them to win and it made me want them to heal.

Author: 1 October 2013
Review_Url: What a great movie! One of the best in recent years! The movies' messages of redemption and the importance of family are ongoing throughout all the scenes in the movie and excellent acting allows the viewer to ask himself deep questions at the end. How much pain must a person go through before he is redeemed? How much pain must a person go through that allows him not to forgive? How important is family? Is there a point where it is too late to change the past? And many more. This is not an action-packed sports-movie, that is an original and realistic drama that takes place in the world of mixed martial arts and it is definitely a must-see and one of those movies that every movie fan waits for.

Author: 6 May 2014
Review: An excellent tear inducing movie, that left me on the edge of my seat
Review_Url: Warrior, directed by Gavin O' Connor in 2011, is a powerful and emotional driven movie that places three men into an everlasting feud, until two of them begin to fight over it physically. Between battling their relentless pasts, their undecided futures, their persistent financial struggles, and lifelong regrets, Warrior has to do a lot more with just two men who duke it out in a ring until one of them lies unconscious. Tommy (Tom Hardy) and Brendan (Joel Edgerton) are two brothers who both struggle with financial and personal issues. Their past has them against each other, and both of them struggle to find a truce between one another. When a competition in wrestling comes to town with a $5 million prize, it leads them onto a collision course with one another to determine who takes the money, and the pride over the other. It's the emotional power, and the visualization of the physical pain that the characters go through which makes Warrior an excellent film, and one I would truly recommend.

Review_Url: The Warrior is overdramatic to the point of hilarity. I could see this being a Harmony Korine film about what he imagines what sports masculinity is all about. A ton of laughs! Tom Hardy mumbles and sulks around with terrible posture like a teenager but he's actually a war hero who fights. His brother is a physics teacher who fights and there's some weird side story about his principal and students rooting for him. There's a Russian fighter who is a rip off of Fedor Emelianenko. Great movie, as inspirational as Weekend at Bernie's.

Author: 26 July 2013
Review_Url: I loved it! The story of family pain relationship heart ache Forgiveness. From the start of the movie I was glued to the screen. Tom hardy is an awesome actor. The whole cast did a great job. The fight choreography was great kudos to the fight and stunt coordinator. More films can take a page out of this book. the blending of the lives tying the stories together and then sealing it all at the end. The only thing I would have loved to see is the teacher give his brother half or some of the money to help out the family of the fallen soldier. Maybe a flash forward in life at the end of the film. maybe during the credits. All in all the film was great.

Author: 11 September 2011
Review: One of the most intense movies ever ....
Review_Url: I am not a fan of MMA but I am sure that its history is much less than WWE. While a lot of people watch and follow WWE just because of its story lines and "acts", MMA fans usually watch MMA fights for real fights. Fights are real and the outcome at times could be between life or death. The intensity behind and beneath its fights should be portrayed much more than WWE matches. Warrior delivers the intensity up to the maximum level it possibly can. I do think fight scenes are good enough. Obviously if you haven't watched MMA in your whole life, you need to be with someone that at least can tell you the rules. I was with my wife and she is definitely no fan of MMA, boxing, WWE, etc...and I explained to her the difference between MMA, WWE and Boxing. The acts are great. I will be shocked if I don't see some Oscar nomination. One of the story lines is everyday - unfortunately for these days - life of many of us. The other story line at least from my point of view needed more information. It was good to see both sides of a human being in his life however the story doesn't give you time to feel close to the character,when he does something heroic and when he runs away. When I saw that Warrior came out 3d in box office, I thought people might be biased toward a movie about MMA - and many may say wth is MMA - so I decided to get the review out. Once again it's an INTENSE movie so if you are on a date and looking for a romantic movie definitely it's not recommended but if you want to see why and how some people go to the CAGE to FIGHT for a GOAL, this is definitely a movie to watch.

Review: A mediocre effort with the cast giving the Midas' touch
Review_Url: Okay. There are probably a thousand movies with the same plot, the same character build-up and the equally probable climax. All due respect to the director, but there is no fantastic direction that takes this movie to a whole different level, a good different level. The screenplay is ordinary, the photography linear, the direction, if not great, but very textbook. Plenty of fights for the action junkie to get high on too, and a lot of clichéd drama coupled with it. And this is not why this movie is different from the rest of them.

Author: 6 January 2012
Review: From beginning until end, "Warrior" is more than fight-drama movie
Review_Url: At the beginning. I've seen the running time of this movie, 140 minutes and I thought that it would be kind of tired. However anyone can make mistakes like I did, the fact is that this movie is very interesting from beginning to end not only for the fight scenes, but also for the story that we can see. Most of the people have problems between brothers, and some of them can lead into a fight, but have you ever imagine to solve it into a ring? That's the reason why this movie can be so shocking. The soundtrack is perfect, beautiful instrumental and lyrics songs that are in the company of a magnificent screen play. We have to recognize the role of Joel Edgerton as Brandon that is, in my opinion, one of the roles that deserves to be recognized with an Academy award.

Author: 14 January 2012
Review: Great movie, awesome over all acting, must see
Review_Url: I was on holidays when i seen this movie advertised on TV, i thought "oh great another sport/fighting movie"(like fighter, and the wrestler.) , and honestly the only reason i watched it was because of tom hardy, for his up coming role in batman,and luckily i did watch it because clearly i was dead wrong, as soon as i got to the first fight scene i was sucked in, being very interested by hardy's mysteries character, and loving the man with a heart and a will to go on(edgertons character), this movie will make you smile, cheer and shed a tear,all around great performances by everyone, the only thing that i found wrong with this was the ending and NOTE to those readers who haven't watched it this is kinda.. a SPOILER ALERT!! okay now.. i love the brothers in arms, walking away scene very emotional and well thought of but in the end and i'm sure i speak for a lot of people and they want to know what happened to hardy's character they don't tell us that maybe he got off, and didn't do jail time, got the money for his mates fiancé, and now has a healthy relationship with his brother and dad. thats what i would like to know, but other then that i love this movie from start to finish, a great movie maybe even some Oscar nomination's. 8/10

Author: 27 January 2012
Review: When a man returns home to find redemption, he was able to find it and more.
Review_Url: When I read the title of this film, I thought it would be one of those films in which I would be immensely disappointed in. But I was glad to be wrong, and more glad that I looked passed the title and viewed the film on my own willingness and accord. And this was one of those you shouldn't judge by it's cover, in this case it's the title, not the cover.

Author: 29 February 2012
Review_Url: I had no interest in watching this film to begin with, I'm not much of a sports fan, I don't like violence and doubted it would be as good as Rocky, The Wrestler, Raging Bull etc so why bother. I don't even know what MMA stands for. It was only seeing the many decent ratings by you beautiful people, my flixster friends, who convinced me it was worth a go and I'm glad I did because most of you were right, Warrior is a fantastic film! I really didn't think you could tell another original, compassionate and compelling story in the genres but I was totally wrong, Gavin O'Connor has made a brilliant film. Along with his fantastic direction and the hard work and determination from Hardy and Edgerton and not forgetting the heartbreaking performance from Nolte, it had all the right ingredients for a great film, and it is a great film. Definitely one of my favourite 2011 films.

Author: 31 March 2012
Review: a slow starting and within 15 minutes ..........boom
Review_Url: I rarely cry when ever i see any movie. titanic was one of the few movies i cried at. i even did not cry in the notebook and a walk to remember. but this movie made tears come in my eyes. the best story ever written and the best directed movie ever. there's not one moment that you wont enjoy in this master piece. for every fight won i would punch my hand in the air and give a broad smile. till the end i was glued to the screen. i recommend everyone watch this film.i cried when both brothers fought. the scene was like so painful when Brendan breaks Tommy's hand but Tommy does not give up. he still fights with one hand. and when he cries i feel so sad. also when Tommy taps out when his brother said i love you Tommy. it brought tears to my eyes. the most touching movie ever. i am surprised it got just so little ratings. i would have given it a 9.8 or a 10.

Author: 10 April 2012
Review_Url: This was a truly outstanding movie. I watch a lot of movies and from time to time I get get into some, but not a lot. This movie I was literally standing up, I was talking to the screen, I was punching my own hand with the excitement. I have seen some sad movies, but rarely do I feel anything, But this was a different story. The directing was amazing and the plot was something that you will rarely ever see in movies or on TV. My only regret was I didn't see this movie in theaters. Truly the only thing missing from this masterpiece for me was not seeing it on a huge screen with surround sound. I would recommend this movie to any and everyone. To anyone who is questioning whether or not to watch this movie, PLEASE take my advice and do so.

Author: 31 October 2013
Review_Url: Usually, I am not very emotional over any movie whatsoever. However, this movie made me cry like a little bitch. I was choked up for the whole second half of the movie, and then boom, bawling in front of my computer. I expected this movie to be like every other fighting movie, but it's not. One could even argue that this movie isn't even about the fighting. This isn't one of those sports movies where you know who's going to win. And that's not even the beauty of it. The best part is that moment when you realize you don't even care about the fight, or the winner, at all. And that's when this movie sets itself apart from all other fighting movies.

Review_Url: There is not much in this Mixed Marital art film but it is on the top end of the spectrum, good cast and script with a few well choreographed fights here and there but it's mediocre, not good nor bad, just mediocre which to be fair is the worst thing for films but as you don't get many of this type flying around so it does have its time in the spotlight which is more to say for most that just degrade and get watered down from their B movie titles.

Author: 30 December 2011
Review: Best sports movie ever made. PERIOD.
Review_Url: Writer/Director Gavin O'Connor is a true rising star, and may be the next Ron Howard or James Cameron, but standing on their shoulders capable of more. His innovative cinematography and editing style is crisp and edgy and entirely real world, while his writing skill is truly extraordinary, and his ability to draw the best out of his actors is UNRIVALED in my mind. This is a tough mixed genre... maybe the toughest to direct. Too many interpersonal dynamics to expect believable scenes from start to finish, and far too many crowd scenes to ever expect believable moments, but somehow O'Connor brings the best even out of his extras, and without question, his crew. This is an amazingly raw and believable American tale that is a MUST See for fans of honest drama, Americana, great love stories, or great sport films. Above all, this is, in my opinion, all things considered the greatest sports related movie ever made.

Author: 15 June 2022
Review: The Quest - for a developed plot line
Review_Url: Hardy and Nolte put on great performances in this film. Too bad none of the characters were developed enough to not be cliche. Overall the film reminded me of The Quest, a single elimination martial arts tournament with the best fighters in the world, but instead of a bunch of interesting contrasting styles from all over the world, there is bland MMA and "the Russian". The primary subplot leading up to the fight is that two brothers are really mad at their dad for 'not being there'.

Author: 6 March 2015
Review_Url: "Warrior" wants to be a great sports movie so badly, so desperately, that it loses touch with what I suspect it was supposed to be about all along. Theoretically speaking, everything you could possibly want from an inspirational-but-grounded sports movie is here: Brooding themes of brotherhood, redemption and guilt; a scrappy underdog beating the odds; the indestructible, Ivan Drago-like combatant who looms for our heroes (they've even made him Russian here, despite the fact that he's played by U.S. Olympic Gold Medalist Kurt Angle); and of course the Big Competition at the end, in which all the plot lines are wrapped up in a single-elimination tournament. A lot of this works; director Gavin O'Connor ("Miracle") knows his sports movie tropes well, and how to hit them to maximize their impact. But by focusing too much on the sports movie conventions and not enough on the movie itself, it doesn't punch us in the gut at the end the way it should. It's a lot of impressively empty theater.

Author: 14 June 2015
Review: One of the best movies I have seen!
Review_Url: I wanted to watch a film that I have not heard much of yet. So I started watching this movie without any expectations and without watching a trailer of it. I did not know what kind of film this was. After the first scene I could not get my eyes of this movie. I have seen a couple of movies that had kind of the same plot. However, this still felt like a new experience. It is very nice to see that good movies like this one are still being made. Very well acted and directed. One of my favorite movies of all time! If you are looking for a great movie that mixes up your feelings and make you feel good, then this is the right movie to watch.
